In the other we've also got a good amount of laughably bad, shoddily made ones like "Dungeons & Dragons". Earning itself a likely permanent spot among the worst of is "In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale". It's a film that is not only poorly acted, written and made, but it's also tedious and excruciating to watch. The story follows a man creatively named Farmer (Jason Statham) whose son is killed by an army of orcs I mean Krugs. His wife is captured so off he goes to rescue her from the creatures and their foul overlord, the evil wizard Gallian (Ray Liotta?! Say it isn't so!). He gets some assistance from an old friend Norrick (Ron Perlman? Seriously?). We learn that Gallian is planning on raising an army to overthrow the king of the land (Burt Reynolds) with the help of the king's sniveling, slimy nephew, Duke Fallow (Matthew Lillard). Time for some sword battles, epic battles in the rain, wizardry, some Ringwraith knock-offs and some silly political backstabbing. Take it away Uwe Boll! I'm not going to say that this movie rips off the Lord of the Rings, but there are some elements that are surprisingly similar. We've got the dueling wizards, with John Rhys-Davies (who played Gimli in the Peter Jackson films) playing the good counterpart to Gallian, we've got the armies of orcs, the elf-like forest creatures, the shadowy horse riders that Gallian uses to command his armies and a couple of scenes here and there. I'm not saying that this is a terrible movie because of these though, I'm saying the movie's so bad even if it was the first fantasy film you ever saw it you would have a hard time sitting through it.First of all, what kind of protagonist are we given? A guy named "Farmer". Apparently he calls himself that because he believes that a man is whatever he does. Does that mean that if he becomes the mayor of the town he'll change his name to "Mayor Mayor"? Jason Statham has had his share of bad movies but he's never been more wooden or less charismatic than here. Even when he's throwing boomerangs or inexplicably doing karate kicks, you'll wish the film was following someone else. Singling out Statham isn't quite fair though because pretty much everyone here comes off as an amateur. Matthew Lillard plays his character way over the top. It's a wonder the guy hasn't been thrown in a dungeon under suspicion of every single unsolved murder in the city. Ray Liotta looks absolutely bored in every scene he's in, but might just be trying to turn invisible so no one notices him. Overall, everyone is trying to get through the cringe-worthy dialog as best they can but few escape unharmed. I'd give some examples, but the film's lack of subtitles (an inexcusable sin considering this DVD was released in 2008) makes it hard to quote.I was actually taken aback by how shoddy the action sequences were. Every scene where farmer goes around kicking looks very staged and are not the least bit exciting. Late into the film they explain why our titular character is able to kick so much ass, but until then these Krugs come off as real chumps. A significant amount of them fall down after being kicked in the chest and then never get up and come on, they can't take down an old guy armed with a pickax? Story-wise, it comes off as pretty laughable often. I know it's for dramatic effect, but I'd like to imagine that the reason there happened to be a wedding going on when the Krugs first attack is that they're just jerks and wanted to ruin this perfect day by setting the town on fire and killing everyone in sight. Even the special effects aren't very good. Whenever Farmer throws his boomerang, it's an obvious computer generated effect and several of the environments looks downright cheap. I'm not talking about the sets, which are decent enough. I'm talking about the wide shots with castles and such.To the film's credit the Krugs and done with practical costumes and while their armor and weapons look cheap, at least they don't clash with the hapless villagers they're slaughtering. The elves (or whatever they are called, to my knowledge they were never named in the movie) are played by talented acrobats that do their own stunts. Hurray for faint praise! The fact that I had to re-watch part of the film to jog my memory brings me to the film's biggest flaw: it's too long and it's boring. This beast runs at slightly over two hours and there's just nothing here that will capture your interest. The characters barely have any personalities, the legions of opponents aren't menacing and their masters are one-dimensional. The battles are edited frenetically, meaning you're going to have a hard time figuring out who is winning and which character is dying when things get rough. It's really difficult to explain why the film is boring, but I can easily see people turning this one off before finishing it. It's Uwe Boll's shoddy direction that sinks what could have been at the very least a film that's so-bad-it's-good into an absolute bore to sit through.Not even a reasonably big budget could save the curse of Uwe Boll. "In the Name of the King" proves itself to be a film that is utterly devoid of any fun moments, aside from a few action scenes where you can laugh at them ironically. It's absolutely terrible and I beg of you to stay away from it. (Theatrical version on DVD, January 24, 2014)

reviews.review_title: Fantasy Classic.
reviews.content: Jason Statham was a little bit of a fish out of water but held his own and the rest of the cast was brilliant (and I mean brilliant!). This was an excellent film that will be a staple of any fantasy movie collection. It was marred by some of the combat related effects (crouching tiger, hidden dragon crap - but it's only a few scenes) and a couple odds and ends barely worth mentioning (mostly post-production things like awkward scene changes that many won't even notice). While not campy like 'House of the Dead' Uwe Boll (director) has proved himself to be someone to watch for. This is a must buy for me, and I would check out anything with Boll's name on it now. Too many people expected just another Statham action movie and others didn't go because they couldn't believe Statham in fantasy but where the former is simply a misplaced audience (and cranky about it), the latter has really missed out on an incredible fantasy movie.

reviews.review_title: Worse than Bloodrayne
reviews.content: However, that's like saying stepping in a pile of dog turds is worse than getting pooped on by a flock of seagulls... Who gives Uwe money to keep making films!?! Why do I watch them? Regardless, I couldn't finish it so it gets a 2. Having said that, not everything was terrible -- eg, the sets were fine -- so, it's not a 1.

reviews.review_title: We can't all be Peter Jackson, but so what?
reviews.content: I enjoyed this film very much. I really don't see why so many people panned it as mercilessly as they did. I think too many people are jaded by the typecasting they perceive automatically when they see certain actors in a film. But that's called prejudice, and it is unbecoming of anyone with an ounce of sophistication. So this film is not likely to win any academy awards? Big deal! That doesn't mean it's a 3.8 out of 10. It was a good story and told quite lucidly, which is more than I can say for many of the silly films that do sometimes get nominated or win academy awards. I would take this film over a bushel of films like the English Patient or Shakespeare in Love or Out of Africa or Gosford Park, yada-yada-yada. Snobby, desiccated films about boring people living futile, boring, wasted lives centered around their own bloated egos. SNORE! I would much rather see a film like this than have George Lucas defecate another of his Star Wars turds on us, or see another Twilight saga sequel vomited at us. Or even worse, another secretion of one of those idiotic Underworld manure piles dropped on us. LIghten up! Sometimes it's better to rip off something good than make an original film that's just insipid and boring. At least they are trying to rip off something worth watching, instead of boring us to death with another actual Star Trek film! Yikes!!!!

reviews.review_title: Two dissenters,we liked it?!
reviews.content: Look this is not a great film .But my daughter and I enjoyed it on a rainy afternoon.Great actors:Perlman,Reynolds,Liotta,and a true action star in Jason Statham.Yes ,the movie is derivative,but so are most films.Yes, the action scenes are a bit repetitive but not nearly as repetitive as the way overlong Lord of The Rings flicks . Furthermore,some of the dialog doesn't work but a lot of it is intentionally laugh outload funny.The stunts are often terrific especially the one where Statham fights while riding under a horse.It is as good as legendary stuntman Yakama Kannuk in a old Three Mesquiteers western.Wow! We enjoyed this flick.Uneven? Indeed .3 out of 10? Not on a rainy afternoon!!Go in with low expectations,like you would have for an old B western and have a real good time.

reviews.review_title: Don't listen to the negative comments - this movie ROCKS!!
reviews.content: It seems like people either love this movie or hate it. Well, you know what? I loved it! I don't care what anyone else says. The cast kicks butt - many of my favorite actors and actresses have been brought together. The characters and the plot are wonderful. My only two complaints are that the ending should have gone on for 5 or 10 more minutes and there was a part at the end that they should have changed. I won't be more specific so as not to give anything away. But, overall, FABULOUS!! The best way to know is to see for yourself. If you are a huge fan of castles and sorcery and swords and kings - you will definitely love this movie.

reviews.review_title: Uwe Boll's clone of LOTR is just a wasting of time!!!
reviews.content: Y'day in the evening I've wasted a couple of hrs watching this piece of crap on DVD. Uwe Boll's clone of LOTR is total rip off from other movies and it's totally predictable and unwatchable. Stupid dialogue, poor script, acting of all stars in this movie is forgettable. I can't understand why and for whom this movie has been made? For DVD rental store? It's a real shame that such nice actors like Statham,Ray Lliota and Ron Perlman took their parts in this garbage. Maybe they did not write the script beforehand? Or they are ready to star in any movie for money. PLS SKIP THIS MOVIE OUT, DO NOT REPEAT MY MISTAKE!!! I never saw any Boll's movies before and I guess that in case I'll find his name in the credits to the movie,then it'll be a sign for me to miss it. And what about Burt Reynolds also? How he can to act in such film, I can't understand it either. So this flick is another one stinker to be totally forgotten...BE AWARE AND ACHTUNG!!!

reviews.review_title: Uwe Boll who?
reviews.content: To start off, I have never heard of Uwe Boll or seen any of his previous movies...and I thank God for that being the case, for what transpired the other night made me want to actually physically get out of my chair, dial 118118 and find out where Uwe Boll lives and go there and hurt him so he realises what I went through watching his movie.My flatmate bought this on DVD under the pretence that it had some big name stars in it, Ray Liotta, John-rhys-davies, Jason Statham, Ron Perlman, Claire Forlani in a fantasy/LOTR-esquire movie and would therefore be good. No, no it wasn't. The dialogue was clunky, the storyline random, the music even worse, the film itself 2 hours too long, it has no redeeming features!First off when "Farmer" first meets the nasty Krug, he uses a boomerang to knock them down! The little kid in Mad Max 2 had a boomerang and threw it with more venom than Jason Statham did! Ron Perlman giving the kid a pig, why? A whole line from the King talking about seaweed? Maybe I just drifted out but it was definitely there. The whole scene where Jason Statham is proclaimed King, yet they still refer to him as "Farmer", maybe even King Farmer? (Surely he has a proper name, though I doubt that cos his wife even calls him "Farmer", gotta love those writers), the Ninja bells, purpose of these were? And could someone explain to me why the Krug decide to lob themselves on fire from their catapults and not use rocks instead? So, what we've learnt, 1. If you find this movie, anywhere, try your best to burn it, smash it, snap it, anything to prevent others seeing this or buying it and encouraging Mr Boll further. 2.Uwe Boll should be banned from owning a camera or coming up with ideas unless under strict supervision from a responsible adult. 3. Avoid this like you would every nasty disease ever known to man, even if you like S&M you will not enjoy this movie.

reviews.review_title: Am I the only person who genuinely loves this film?
reviews.content: I love all things epic and/or fantastical. Sometimes, they can be a little too childish IE Willow of Narnia, but In The Name Of The King is just pure escapist fantasy. The cast is just incredible Ron Perlman and Leelee Sobieski being particular highlights, but Matt Lillard's spoilt prince is flawlessly performed, and Jason Statham is quickly becoming one of the best action stars out there.Sure it's campy, sure it has a lovable B-movie chic about it, sure the script is cliché laden, this isn't and never set out to be a cinematic masterpiece like Gladiator, this is a breathless, 100 mile an hour romp where good takes on evil and triumphs.The film is WAY ahead of it's time in terms of it's dealing with issues such as race and gender. I mean what other film has black men in it, who are just men who happen to have black skin? Not ONE reference is made to their skin colour, and neither do they reference it. White, black, they are just MEN. No lame "white men can't jump" "humour" on which the Wayans seem to be basing their careers on after exhausting their limited repertoire of self-contradictory humour, no anti-racism "Ah ain't fightin' alongsahd no negros" subplot where a racist suddenly accepts his black brethren before the climactic battle, just MEN being MEN. Finally.For the pennies they had to make this, it's a damn well-made film, I can remember straight to video movies used to be "those films where the helicopter doesn't crash", but now, whoa, thousands of men chopping each other to bits in a forest, impressive though never intrusive CGI, great costumes, the cinematography is beautiful, I could go on all night.To those who have attacked the villain henchmen of the film, the "Krug", they are great! Sure, the masks are set pieces that I'm sure if they were featured in close-ups would look as fake as they are, but Boll knows his craft, and shows them only fleetingly and with enough distance to make them believable.While definitely fantasy, I am glad this film sits more towards the realistic side of things, almost to the point where it could be considered historical fiction, were it not for the modest amount of magic that kept the film within the boundaries of fantasy. Also, much kudos for not including Elves or Dwarfs, whose presence I usually find irritating. "Oh, so this race is tall, noble, and lives indefinitely, and this race are 3 foot tall, dour and very good at digging? Good good, so only the human race has a variety of professions it is capable of and greatly variable personalities?" Elves are stuck up, aloof snobs impossible to relate to, and dwarfs are just patronising caricatures of the Scottish.Back to my main point, ITNOTK is awesome, one which shall be watched again and again, and sits with my DVDs with pride.

reviews.review_title: Here's the reason . . .
reviews.content: I've never heard of this director - but it doesn't matter.When you watch a movie like this, it's clear that whoever directed it was over-directing & too controlling. I felt like he stifled & didn't trust his actors. It felt like they were micro-managed.The movie had great actors & great potential - Statham & a few of the other actors were excellent - but it was clear only they were carrying the movie with good acting.And that was a miracle given the obvious poor direction.This movie shows that the ability to act in spite of poor script/cheesy dialogue AND poor direction can be overcome - but even they can only carry so much.The good actors can't do a thing about weaker actors who can't deal with bad direction, and the good actors can't do much about lighting & the cutting of the film, or the dumb, over-dramatic scenes the director is filming.These directorial mishaps & poor cutting is why this film got the 3.8.It's a real shame because again, this had a lot of potential.Btw, the only vague similarity to Lord of the Rings - .is some fantasy magic, & an animal-like army.Otherwise, it cannot even remotely be compared to an epic of that proportion & high caliber, which not only had amazing actors, but it EXCELLED in every facet of cinema from direction, wardrobe, locations, CGI, lighting, and more, beginning with an amazing author & story.Back to THIS movie review - thumbs down.

reviews.review_title: Why does everyone slate Uwe Boll films?
reviews.content: First off, I'm no way connected to the production of any of his films! Im just tired of unintelligent internet community slating good enjoyable films. OK so this film wasn't Lord of the Rings, was it advertised as LOTR? Apart from John Rhyss Davies did it have any other connections with LOTR? NO! It was a completely different story. I found this film to be enjoyable, OK not Oscar material but this film was entertaining none the less. The characters were good, and completely in line with the Game. The whole film felt like Dungeon Siege. I have played the game and completed it, and I can say that Uwe has captured that feel in the movie. The cinematography is very good, especially where Merricks daughter is riding away from the Duke. This film also has a kicking soundtrack, some great actors, and its a lot of fun to watch. The only bad thing about the film is Matthew Lillard, he hammed up his role the way only he can, he should be shot! If you want an entertaining film that will delight the family this is it, if your after a multiple Oscar winning film (The voting was rigged!) then watch LOTR. I will have to find more Uwe Boll films now, as after watching Alone in the Dark the other night I am becoming a fan of his work.

reviews.review_title: not that bad at all
reviews.content: Oh dear, what is it with you guys? Suppose you're the same sort of people who think that the latest James Bond films are awesome (er, not good at all)...or that The Dark Knight is a masterpiece (as far removed from anything Batman that you can get...)? This actually wasn't that bad at all, good entertaining fun, everything including the kitchen sink thrown into this sword and sorcery tale. Jason was on top form as always, the chicks were hot, Liotta and Reynolds in scene-chewing form, great locations, on par special effects, happy ending. Go watch it on a transatlantic plane flight to whittle the time away and just chill out...

reviews.review_title: German Roger Corman
reviews.content: If you're not into fantasy roleplaying games...don't even bother. If you are, it's okay but your game last weekend was probably more fun. If you support '80s-style independent student B-movies...it's worth seeing, but hold off until it hits the bargain cinemas. That being said, Uwe Boll is the German answer to Roger Corman. If you dig his stuff, it's okay so long as you don't expect scintillating film-making. Do expect some really glaring plot holes and dangling threads. Summation: The visuals and fight scenes were great, John Rhys-Davies sucketh never, the directing and writing were awful, but it makes up for it's sins by giving a lot of sincere young film students a bit of practice and a toe in the door.

reviews.review_title: Not even Leelee could save this one
reviews.content: To be quite honest I watched this film only because Leelee Sobieski is so smoking hot - but I was also curious to what this Boll character is all about. From what I known he is almost religiously frowned upon on these forums.I was not very happy about this piece of work. Strangely some well known and quite decent actors (notably John Rhys-Davies and Jason Statham) was lured into this project - and their performances are pretty much all the quality this film has to offer.Scripting and directing is, at best - on par with an episode of Xena The Warrior Princess. The editing is even worse, with strangely cut pauses in dialog and music breaks that clearly does not fit in. Special effects are clear-as-day CGI, but that is to be expected from a low budget flick. Also on the technical side I couldn't help to notice that some scene were notably blurry, with poor colors and also strange blurry panning - almost as the direct view recording (or whatever it's called) was used instead of the main camera at some points.To sum things up, if you decide to watch this despite all the warnings - make sure to have a couple of drinks handy. At least that would help you laugh at some of this, or even better put you to a calm sleep.

reviews.review_title: Lets be objective.....
reviews.content: Good. - Thought the casting was OK, and the actors performed at their usual level of performance. Jason was his usual brooding, menacing action hero. John Rhys Davies was acting, Matthew Lillard was comical and Ray was wonderfully over the top.the story was the usual run of the mill for this genre and anyone who loves it will know what to expect (Except for the ninjas and the interesting use of catapults).The soundtrack was outstanding.CGI was adequate.bad - C'Mon, the Krug were comically bad and this was the thing that really let the film down.Differently - Perhaps if the team had actually not tried as hard with the krug and gone for heavy make-up and less prosthetics then they might of been more menacing. As LOTR's proved the monsters need to be able to act as well.I hated parts of this film, laughed at some and genuinely enjoyed others. Bit miffed that i bought it at full price - should of waited for bargain bin sales!

reviews.review_title: Okay, not Tolkien
reviews.content: Never understood why people can rate a movie 1 or 10. I found it quite entertaining. And Jason is, as always, very enjoyable to watch. His 'surroundings' too. No, dont understand the negatives.

reviews.review_title: Pretty bad on almost every level
reviews.content: I am basing this review on the theatrical cut of In the Name of the King, not the Director's Cut which i have not seen. As a reference I am using Peter Jackson's The Lord of the Rings trilogy as firstly, I believe all three films to be fantastic and secondly as Boll is clearly trying to copy Jackson's success and fails miserably.So let's begin:Acting/Casting: The casting of his films is probably the one thing Uwe Boll can be praised for as he often has very well known and talented actors on screen. This is also the case here, however most of the cast (Ron Perlman, Jason Stratham, John Rys-Davis) are clearly not very interested in their roles. To be fair, there are good performances: Claire Forlani is the sole highlight of the film (the scene in which she learns her son has died is actually very well done) and does well despite her character being pretty one-dimensional. Ray Liotta and Matthew Lillard are both so ridiculously over-the-top its impossible not to smile when they're on screen. Yes these characters are stupid, underdeveloped and uninteresting but this is not the actors fault and they do their best with the awful screenplay. In their scenes it is almost as if Boll is making a parody of fantasy films yet in the next scene we realize we are meant to be taking this seriously.Effects/Costume: In the fantasy genre it is important to create a world for the audience to be immersed in, e.g. Middle Earth in LotR. In Jackson's trilogy we had a sense of the different cultures and their environments and here we get a generic world called Eb and generic monsters (Krug). The effects are standard yet clearly not as well developed as in LotR. For example we never see the Kurg up close for longer than a second and the structures (the castles of the king and of the villain) are shown briefly and again always at a distance, resulting in the audience feeling underwhelmed. I'm aware that Boll was working on a smaller budget, however it was still pretty high (60 million dollars) and i feel more could have been done here.Editing: This is one of the bigger flaws of the film and can be seen best in the opening 15 minutes. There are many scenes here: Farmer working at his farm and feeling uneasy about an approaching danger. His wife Solana at the market. Farmer fighting at his farm and then with Norrick. Solana at her brother's house.These scenes are all inter cut and Boll cannot stay with one scene for more than a few seconds and in doing so cannot build any tension. This is made worse by the fact that we have a fight scene (Farmer and Norrick) followed by a scene in which the dialog is essentially exposition. Granted, Jackson also does this (e.g. cutting from the battle of Helms Deep to Merry and Pippen in Fangorn Forest), however the characters there had already been established and in the scenes with Merry and Pippen there is more happening than just exposition.Action: In a film with a fairly large budget but a horrible script, at least the action scenes should be engaging. Sadly, this is not the case. Either the battles are shot like a modern day action movie (imagine Transporter with swords and shields) which seems out of place or are on a grander scope yet still nothing to write home about and remain less involving than the smallest battle in LotR. There is also the fundamental problem that the battles have no "structure" so to speak. For example: The battle of Helms Depp in TT had a beginning, a moment where all seemed lost and finally victory for the heroes. Here all we get is 10 minutes of fighting ending with victory. There is never any build up so there is no tension, there seems to be nothing at stake so we don't really care.Screenplay: It's horrible. Simply horrible. Even without some unintentionally funny lines it would still be bad. Apart from the shallow characters and plot holes, it just tries too hard to be poetic and meaningful yet ends up sounding like someone trying desperately to sound eloquent. And the ending pretty much sums it up: After Gillian's death the movie stops about 30 seconds later. What is the point? I know a lot people complained about the ending of RotK yet there was a purpose to it. Here it is so abrupt it's as if the filmmakers just stopped caring and wanted to end it as fast as possible. Another example: At one point one of the heroes loses a person very close to her and her reaction is to look blankly at his body before turning around leaving him lying on the ground. WHY? Why should we invest anything in a character who so obviously doesn't care about the people most dear to her?Originality: Now here is why i wanted to use LotR as a reference. Let's go through the story and find the similarities:Both start in the countryside with fields/crops and the music is also similar. Krug are obviously cheap Orcs. A wise wizard helping the hero on his quest. A villain in a tower/castle with the ability to see over the land (Sauron with his eye, Gillian with magic) The villain producing Krugs/Orcs in an underground "factory" (these scenes are so clearly ripping of LotR's Saruman it's almost pitiful) A race of creatures with a connection to nature. A small force entering the villains lair as a large army would fail. A hero starts as a loner and becomes king.Need i say more?So to finish: 2/10 for the average performance by Forlani and the entertaining performances by Liotta and Lillard.

reviews.review_title: take a 10 year old who is really sleepy, explain to them what LOTR is about and then ask them to make their own version
reviews.content: I thought I should put that my review contains a spoiler but its more of a warning, Don't WASTE YOUR TIME. I consider mine to reasonably valuable. I decided to watch this over "The Assassination Of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford" this remains one of the gravest errors I've ever made.A couple of years ago I watched 1000 maniacs with Robert Englund, that stood then as the worse film I had ever watched, having worked in Video Shop for three years with an enormous back catalogue that is a hell of a lot of films to choose from. Dungeon Siege has seized the title vehemently and with both hands. I thought at first it was Jason Stathams fault, but its not really. Maybe it was John Rhys Davies who on paper should have shone like a diamond in a pile of dog muck but no. Its all down to this Uwe Boll feller. I mean seriously how can you Produce and Direct a film and its two sequels (Bloodrayne) in a matter of two years? Well I suppose that you can but you'll end up with rubbish. Its like having 10 kids whilst working 60 hour weeks,they are going to be neglected, 8 of them will have failed marriages, one will be a sex offender and one will be a serial killer, guaranteed. Dungeon Siege is one of the failed marriages, failed because its boring, irrational and cr*p (in bed)

reviews.review_title: If you love bad movies, this is a must see
reviews.content: Yet another movie based on a video game by director Uwe Boll and this one isn't any better. This time, he was able to break the bank and get the biggest names he could find, even if the actors were completely wrong for the part. The casting for this movie makes no sense and I hope that the actors involved were well paid, because a movie like this can't be good for anyone's career.The only redeeming quality, if there is one, is that the storyline isn't quite as much of a train wreck as the rest of the movie. It's still relatively lame and derivative, but has a couple of twists and surprises that keep your attention.Really, the only reason you may want to watch this movie is to laugh at how bad it is.

reviews.review_title: Surprise
reviews.content: I was pretty curious to see what a movie could come out of such a boring game. I was pleasantly surprised. It is not a very good movie, but good entertainment anyway.

reviews.review_title: Entertaining.
reviews.content: It is not top quality Hollywood material by a fair distance. But it's beyond a TV movie for quality - the actors are good (not close to Oscar performances but they do the job) and the effects would have been good for 2000AD. And the action sequences would have been good for pre matrix days.The fact that the film is not up to high budget modern standards, and that it is based on a video game, and that the main guy is called 'Farmer', and that it bombed on the box office, and that it the plot (like most fantasy) is heavily influenced by lord of the rings, that the director has a bad rep for buying film rights and funding his projects with German Government tax rebates, does not stop it from being a fun film to watch.

reviews.review_title: Exceptional
reviews.content: Wow, this was something. From the action sequences to the dialogue, this film will make you laugh. Character motivations often seem confused, the krugs look like fat guys coated in dried mud, many of the special effects look ridiculous, and the overall cinematography makes it feel like the director had no idea what they were doing*. So bad it's good, put it on with a group of friends and alcohol, and roast it!Having seen some of the director's other work, this does seem to be the case.

reviews.review_title: HAHAHHA really??
reviews.content: Well, I loved Jason Statham after seeing Snatch, Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, and The Transporter movies. Always a great unconventional bad ass protagonist. Sadly, he did not improve upon the quality of this terrible, terrible film. Bad script that not even a great cast could improve upon. I love action/violence in movies, even the cheesy ones, but this was simply unbearable. Burt Reynolds as the king was unbearable. That guy that is Farmer's friend (he played Hellboy) has the worst dialogue and mannerisms in any character of a movie I've seen. I rented this for $1 and I actually regret it.... I recommend all those fantasy-loving action suckers to avoid this.. no matter how tempting it may be.

reviews.review_title: Can I give this a zero?
reviews.content: I hate admitting that I wasn't drunk or high when I rented this. I like Jason Statham, Ray Liotta, Matthew Lillard, and several other cast members. Although I had my doubts that any of them could pull off a fantasy movie, I was willing to give them a chance. What I failed to notice was that Uwe Boll was directing this steaming pile of crap. My bad. So so my bad.Even if you were willing to give it a try and suspend a lot of disbelief (Like how did people have those haircuts in that time period), the next clue that you made the wrong viewing choice comes pretty quickly -- the moment the "movie" starts, the "score" starts, and it is so obnoxious and distracting that I'm sure it was intended to cause sensory overload so viewers wouldn't notice everything else that was wrong. It was nothing short of aural rape.I really can't find a single positive thing to say about this movie. Whoever is still giving money to Uwe to make movies, I urge you to stop.

reviews.review_title: Setting some reminders on this.. Not as bad as the reviews indicate.
reviews.content: The first thing you have to remember when watching a movie is this: Know the genre and it's limitations. This was obviously intended to be sold mostly on "star-power." Statham is arguably "THE" guy for an all out action film today. Liotta is a "Mob Man" who moonlights as a dramatic actor. Lillard's simply a comedy guy... and not a very good one! Reynolds was perhaps the single best cast role in the film, was very "Kingly" despite some scripting problems. Finally, all I can think of when I see Pearlman anymore is.. Hellboy!That all being said. Was it a 10? Definitely not. Is it worth a rent? I would say yes, if you're looking for an action flick that you don't have to analyze. The acting could have had better direction. I can only assume it was lack of direction, as most of the big actors in this film have turned out some stellar work. I've seen a lot worse come out of film-city recently. Stop comparing it to LOTR and enjoy it for what it is, an action movie based on a video game.5.6 out of 10 (Had to round it up on the rating system here)Casting: 4 - Simply too many actors, from too many different backgroundsActing: 5 - Could have been worse, could have been betterCinematography: 7 - Great scenery, brought down by bad direction.Plot: 5 - I give credit for not remaking another film, but it simply has an overly "written" script.Costume Design: 7 - The "Krug" were pretty bad, but everything else brings this score up a lot.

reviews.review_title: Good Movie, 10 out of 10. Hey, whoever you are Uwe Boll, pay me!
reviews.content: JA_Japster: "Oh, and those ten star reviews you keep reading? Uwe Boll has to be paying them. I can't imagine anyone out there (even on the internet) is THAT stupid to consider this a good movie." How I wish I was paid by who? Uwe Boll? For giving this movie full stars. I don't care who made it, who the director was, the producer, the writer, or if it was original, based from some game or book, I don't care either who the actors were. I criticize movies based on what it is, a movie. And with that said, "In the Name of the king" is a good movie if you look at it as it is.Compare it with Lord of the Rings? I can't imagine anyone out there (even on the internet) is THAT stupid to compare this good movie to Lord of the Rings.C'mon! Comparing this movie to LotR is like comparing apples to oranges. Two totally different league. This movie's simplicity earned my full star vote. Yes there are some miscalculations and bad editing, but overall it is a good movie if you look at it as it is.

reviews.review_title: I liked the credits...
reviews.content: Now, I only decided to watch this movie because I heard Blind Guardian (one of my favorite bands ever. Probably because they are one of the best bands ever) supplied some music for this. I was hoping that maybe, just maybe Skalds and Shadows or Carry the Blessed Home would be featured in the actual movie, but of course not. They were put as simple credit songs. What a waste...Anyway, the movie is objectively crap. It's like it's trying to be crappy as opposed to actually striving to be a good epic movie.Also I have to comment on the cast. Jason Statham as an epic hero? Um...I don't think that works. Stick to your gritty crime action flicks, buddy. You've been type-casted. John Rys-Davis was pretty good though. He's like the only casting guy they got right for this movie. Burt Reynolds as a king? The guy who played freaking Shaggy as an evil duke? Please make good casting choices next time... Actually no. Don't let there be a next time.Also the Krug or Kwum or Krap, whatever they're called were kind of bland... Just like this movie.Maybe Blind Guardian should have played through out the whole thing, that would have made it worth it... Also it would mask the poor dialogue...

reviews.review_title: Not worth the money
reviews.content: OK, so after looking at the list of actors and actresses that are in this film, Jason Statham, John Rhys-Davies, Leelee Sobieski, Ray Liotta, Burt Reynolds, etc..., I honestly thought this would have been a decent movie. Within minutes of the movie starting, something didn't seem right. It was the script. A modern-day vocabulary and speech set in a medieval setting just doesn't work. Some of the CGI was OK, but the costumes and makeup for the animal-warriors looked like you could get at a Halloween store. After 10 minutes of my ears hurting from the horrible script and my eyes hurting from the costumes and two cheesy fight scenes, I turned off the movie. I will be asking Blockbuster for a refund.

reviews.review_title: I think the consensus is the same across the board.
reviews.content: Much like the other user that posted a comment on this movie, I saw this movie based solely on the fact that Jason Statham was in it. He is my favorite actor, and I try to see everything he is in.Going in to this movie, I did not realize the king of horrible movies based on video games, Uwe Boll, was behind this. I guess I should have known better, but I didn't. Regardless, when I was watching the previews before the movie, and I saw the trailer for his upcoming debacle known as "Postal", I knew I was doomed.Uwe Boll is a horrible, horrible person. Why he intentionally punishes the movie-going audience with garbage like this is beyond me.I recall reading in "X-Box Magazine" a quote from an interview he did. Boll basically went on about how he was angering everyone in the video game community, and how he would continue to make horrible movies just to show people that their opinions don't matter to him, including a 3-picture deal that included "Postal".Why? Why would you intentionally want to aggravate so many people, especially when it costs money to make these horrible films, and you end up losing money when so few people see them? Even with these movies for sale on DVD, I can guarantee they're not selling. I have seen copies of "Alone in the Dark" and "House of the Dead" in $5.00 dump bins at Wal-Mart, and even then, they don't sell.People are calling Uwe Boll the "Modern Day Ed Wood", and while that is fitting, I'd almost say it's actually an insult to Ed Wood. Yes, Wood made horrible films, but I don't think he was such an arrogant jerk about it.I mean, making movies just to tick people off. What kind of issues can a guy have to do that?

reviews.review_title: OK time waster
reviews.content: This film is not nearly as bad as some people seem to think (I liked it better than the recent batman that was so gosh darn popular). Yeah its corny, and the acting is not the best I've seen (to say the least), but it had some decent action. The evil wizard guy kept reminding me of William Shatner. Not too many actors have the skill to channel Shatner -- that guy will go far.To confess I saw it on a cross ocean plane ride of some 13 hours in duration and I can think of worst ways to spend time on a long international flight.As I said, its an OK for wasting time, and I'd recommend it to anyone who wants to laugh at a movie.

reviews.review_title: Had low expectations, found it to be as bad as I thought
reviews.content: As someone who dislikes every Uwe Boll movie made, I at least like to give his movies a chance for his redemption in making a good "it's-so-bad" movie and after watching this movie, I'm 99% certain he will never go beyond "average" movies. Everything was simply predictable and so much didn't fit here or there. Let's start from the beginning, shall we? In the first few minutes of the movie, it wasn't that bad. Despite the lack of motivation from the actors/actresses to actually act, I was somewhat surprised by the "fun" feeling I get from bad movies. However, that soon changed when the first battle with the LOTR orc-lookalikes attacked and started to raise hell. It was like watching an episode right out of Hercules: The Legendary Journey, except there was no Kevin Sorbo. Everything from that point on was below average and just dull. The acting, the fighting, the music was way out of place and overused at some times, and the editing was TERRIBLE. I tried watching it as much as I could, but about half-way through began speeding it up every few minutes to see what happen next. In the end, it was just another bad movie.Now, moving away from the cons about this movie, there are some pros I did like about it. Some of the special effects were actually pretty cool and some of the fighting wasn't that bad with Jason doing his usual kick-kick-strike-kick-kick-strike combo like in Transporter. These are the only reasons I'm not giving it a 1 because Jason is an awesome guy who simply got screwed into making this movie. Not just him either, but every actor/actress in this movie was at some point somebody I loved, yet was TERRIBLY miscast. I sympathize with their situation and hope this doesn't hurt their careers in the long run, besides the has-beens.Overall, this is just another bad Boll movie. It doesn't even come close to being average and looks like a LOTR rip-off rather than some video game adaptation. I no longer have the slightest hope that Uwe will actually do something good in his future. STOP GIVING HIM LICENSES TO MAKE THESE MOVIES!

reviews.review_title: Stop whining and watch the movie! It's a great flick.
reviews.content: It's a great movie, i don't understand what everybody is whining about. True that it's not "Lord of the Rings", but if comparing to many other fantasy movies it's a treasure. It's has great action delivered by Jason, a regular fairytale storyline and the humor is not bad at all too. The movie has many great famous actors in it and they do a very good job. Yes the bad guys in the movie may seem nuts. Yes, the movie may seem long, but nothing is perfect. and instead of looking for the bad spots think about the concept behind. and if the movie is too long for you watch it with a break. I will say it again- Stop whining and Watch the Movie, it's GOOD!

reviews.review_title: Exquisite
reviews.content: Disgraceful is the face of humanity that cannot appreciate the marvelous cinema that Uwe Boll artisnally handcrafted. This movie moved me to tears, made me cower behind my concubine's couch, and brought forth in me such a rapturous, unholy rage that aforementioned concubine was tempted to tranq me to calm me down- and that's just within the first 10 minutes. In the Name of the King is like Lord of the Rings, if LOTR was actually, you know, good. This movie will transmogrify your life like nothing else you have ever experienced. And I mean that literally. This movie is not for the cowardly, or the faint of heart. This is a movie that will shake you to your core. God bless Uwe Boll and God save the King. Diego Montoya signing out. Diego Montoya

reviews.review_title: Find another Statham movie!
reviews.content: I like fantasy and somewhat spiritual movies. In that sense this movie could have been good. The story was okay too, but the execution is as the overall rating suggests: crap.First there is the almost constant overwhelmingly loud music, and bad choice of music at that. Very 70s but those days have gone and when it comes to this aspect, a good thing!In itself they did have a strong cast, Jason Statham, Ron Perlman, Ray Liotta, but the way this movie is construed doesn't do them any justice. I love watching Jason do his martial arts, I'm a big Jason & martial arts fan. But even I got fed up with the badly shot and directed scenes. Not even a bloke like Jason can salvage the level of crap.Why the heck they chose to take this amateur-style route is beyond me. They could've pulled it off, I mean, look at LoTR and The Hobbit, and the story itself is viable. This genre can be insanely popular, but then it has to be done right.All in all... even if you're a Jason Statham and martial arts fan like me, forego this one. It really isn't worth it.Oh, and they should NOT have cast Ray Liotta. Not for that role. BAD choice!I'm not usually one for harsh rating, but this one deserves it.

reviews.review_title: It wasn't all that bad.
reviews.content: Let's be honest, if you consider watching an Uwe Boll movie you have to remember that he doesn't aim for an Oscar! In fact I really don't know what he aims for.Nevertheless I wasn't disappointed by the movie, it had action, a cheesy love story and a partially happy ending...what more can you expect? It was the same as many other action movies; it was a pain to watch, if you expected a prime movie, but that isn't what you get with an Uwe Boll movie.What you get is a movie with good CGI, nice action sequences and a shallow plot - all that you can ever expect and want from such a movie.All in all - I have seen worse!

reviews.review_title: A Bunch of Guys Trying to Make The Lord of The Rings
reviews.content: I would not waste much of time by writing a lengthy review. Imagine The Lord of the Rings (with a shitty story) made by a bunch of guys who don't know what to do and how to do it. I knew it was going to be awful from the moment it started but I still watched to see how awful it was and I was not disappointed. It is AWFUL.The acting is awful. The direction is awful. The Story is awful. The visuals are awful (some of them are copied from LotR). The dialogues are awfully funny. It is like a parody of LotR. and it goes on forever. LotR is 11+ hours, but it never feels like 11 hours. This film is just 2 hours, and it feels like decades. STAY AWAY FROM THIS FILM, YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.

reviews.review_title: Not that bad
reviews.content: So you all have something to nag about :) First of all, the directing of the movie -that leans hard on 80's and 90's fantasy-movies- was good enough for its purpose. Nothing wrong with the storyline or effects either. of course there were some clichés involved but the acting was precise, and the cast is good. It's not to compare to "lord of the rings; but i don't think that was the meaning anyway. For all those critics that were writing all these bad comments; Get on and try to enjoy a movie for once without over-analyzing it; it's not a political movie and it wasn't meant to break your little brains either. It's just what it is. But no hard feelings, freedom of speech

reviews.review_title: A dull tedious pile of garbage
reviews.content: This is one of the most badly made and unconvincing movies of all time the production values looked cheap and fake and the costume designs were poor the acting was just as bad and I hated everything else the chemistry between statham and forlani is so dull they make a contender for worst onscreen couple of all time and the performances from Burt Reynolds as the king and Mathew lillard and ray liotta were all terrible they acted like they didn't care and even when John Rhys Davies who is the only one who tries and is I guess the most tolerable is still bad here as his character was killed off at the end truly one of the worst movies in cinema history.

reviews.review_title: Too Long And Cursed
reviews.content: In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale was too long and drawn out. Lots of empty scenes and excessive boring battling. Anything Burt Reynolds is in is simply cursed; I think that selling his soul to Satan has something to do with it.What ruined this movie from start to finish was casting Ray Liotta as the evil mage Gallian. He doesn't look evil but has bad skin, and all the excessive closeups didn't help the situation. His voice was just laughable as being evil, it exuded a very obvious homosexuality. Whether he is gay or not doesn't matter but the fag-o-meter kept going off with every scene he had.All the special effects at the end of the movie couldn't save this mess, nor could Blind Guardian. What were they thinking? It really isn't worth watching, it just wastes too much time with the same trite story that you have already watched many times before.

reviews.review_title: Uwe Boll
reviews.content: I watched this movie not knowing it was a Uwe Boll film. After seeing how bad it was, I was relieved to find out it was one of his.I should stipulate that I'm not a fan of Jason Statham movies. Guy Ritchie kicked off his career with two fantastic films; Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, and Snatch. After that, someone made the mistake of letting him decide his own fate, and he's pumped out a trash load of crappy action films that are meant to stroke his balding ego.That said, I was bored on a weekday, and this film came on, so I went ahead and watched it. And, as most Uwe Boll films do, it did not disappoint to disappoint. It's flat out horrid. It's so bad, you think it could finally bury the devastatingly bad acting career of Statham. Unfortunately, that's not the case, as he's managed to churn out some of his worst films since; Death Race and Transporter 3.The point is, if you're look for the Bizarro world version of a Kubrick/Scorsese-esquire directing career, Uwe Boll is your man. He has made multiple video game-based movies, for f'ing sake! Only a director bent on a career of the most disappointing movies man has ever seen could use as his visionary light a 1990's video game. Bravo, sir, I could drunkenly drool out a better premise.Uwe Boll, if you're reading this, please do something else with your life. Like postal work. Or landscaping. At least the damage you would do to someone's grass would only ruin the lives of one household.

reviews.review_title: Could have been better, but still not the worst that I've seen.
reviews.content: I have to say I didn't read any reviews when I approached this movie. I went to see it with a couple of friends and it wasn't as horrible as I'd thought. Video Game to movie translations are often horrible so that's all that I took with me to go see this movie.Most of the lines are quite cheesy and over the top, but some of the performances were actually pretty nice. I was surprised with Burt Reynolds acting in this movie as I'd never seen him in a serious role before so I thought that it was a change from what I'd seen. He didn't to a stellar performance, but it wasn't all too bad either. I think that it was a very neutral performance.I've seen Lord of the Rings, and of course this doesn't compare to it. But I've also played Dungeon Siege, Dungeon Siege Legends of Aranna, and Dungeon Siege 2 and for the most part it follows the main story. Gas Powered Games was on hand to follow the story through and for the most part I think they did a fairly good job in that.All in all, would I recommend watching it? If it's on TV, maybe.

reviews.review_title: WHY this movie was awful.... Never again.
reviews.content: I must be a glutton for punishment, but I decided to see this movie because with the trailer, it looked like it might have some potential. I have seen only two previous Uwe Bowe films and they were horrible.... I didn't have any high expectations, but I was just hoping this one would be different. Never again.If I were to repeat what a previous reviewer mentioned ... how does he get such fantastic actors to do his movies? Don't these actors know that his movies are terrible? This definitely proves the fact that a good director is ESSENTIAL to a good movie. And that even great actors cannot shine when there is a horrible direction ...I see a lot of posts where people just say that a movie was awful and that Bowe is an horrible director, but don't explain why....I'm not a professional director or anything, but I just want to know if Bowe understands that shooting a scene requires perhaps ... a point, and like, maybe something to be accomplished. This can't be done when the each scene is about 30 seconds long. And just ENDS abruptly - like with a question that doesn't get answered. Slow things down a bit. And maybe EXPLAIN some things.Even with the completely ridiculous dialogue in this movie, character development is very important in a plot - and when an audience is just taken on a whirlwind of different shots that don't linger long enough to fulfill any depth, then we are left with a very confusing and flat storyline. Seriously, is this a movie  or a music video??? There are more cuts in this movie than an international hair show. Obviously Bowe is very sloppy, lazy and doesn't spend the time to make any storyboards I'm sure if he did Greenpeace would be on his ass, cause that'd be a waste of a LOT of paper ....Scenes are also cut in between each other quite frequently. At which it makes things utterly bewildering and a complete mess. Especially when you are inter-cutting a quiet dinner scene with a fight scene. Some really good directors can do it  but there has to be a connection between the scenes. Otherwise it is just idiotic. Remember the scene in ***Spoiler for LOTR: Return of the King*** when Pippin is singing to Denethor and they cut between his song and the battle. That is the sign of a good director. It was done with a reason and is incredibly powerful to the film. I know it ludicrous to compare the two, but just to make my point that there must be some purpose for inter-cutting scenes.In addition, EVERYTHING is scored. Music adds a lot to film, but it is not necessary at every possible second in the movie. A good director is able to incorporate the score and with it, add emotion to a scene without the audience even noticing it. The score in this movie was so overdrawn that it was annoying... in fact it helped to incorporate an deadly element of cheesy melodrama....It's quite obvious that Bowe is attempting to shadow the Lord of the Rings trilogy as he quite blatantly steals many components of the films. However, comparing him to Peter Jackson... well ...I can't even write both their names in the same sentence.This movie had tremendous potential. But adding Bowe into it is like dropping some fish sauce into your Lemon Meringue Pie.Don't waste money on this movie. I couldn't even finish it. It's terrible. And these are reasons why I believe so.

reviews.review_title: Seriously are you kidding?
reviews.content: Okay, first off, I wanted to say that I just registered for this site mainly for the sake of leaving a comment for this movie. I wanted to watch this movie without much expectations, except to see Jason Statham kick some serious ass like most of his other films. I asked a friend of mine, who have seen the movie first, if the movie was any good and his reply was that it is "watchable," which deterred me not to jump and go watch it right away. I did not know about any of the negative reviews that it received nor that it was directed by Uwe Boll 'til after the film. If his name was shown in the opening scene, I, unfortunately, must've missed it (would've save me all the confusion of why is this movie so bad).When watching the movie, I was amazed that there were so many great actors in this, even though some are out right mis-casted. As it went on, it made me wonder why are the dialogs so cheesy and predictable (seriously, I was saying the lines before the actors did). The story did not keep me in-tune with the movie at all. There were just too many scenes where you're supposed to sympathize with the character, but instead it made you flinch with laughter at how badly it was executed, like when the mother finds out that her parents and son were killed. You simply don't connect with the characters at all. I figured that the action and special effects will redeem the bad writing and bad editing. But I was wrong. The camera shots were horrible, it made all the fight scenes feel so mundane and cliché that it made me bored. If these same fight scenes were done with better camera shots, it would've made a bigger difference. All the costumes were terrible; the Krogs reminded me of monsters that I've seen in those Power Ranger shows, they're not menacing at all; the knights' armors that are meant to be metal, looked like hard plastic; Ray Liotta's mage (or whatever he is supposed to be) costume made him look like he is not from that era, it didn't fit the movie. Its as if he was busy making another movie and they pulled him in to make this one and just let him wear that same outfit. There was a scene where one of his outfits looked like something that Sigfried and Roy would have in their closet. The sound effects didn't do the sword fighting any justice either, it was like they used the same sword clashes and tweaked it a little here and there, plainly awful. I think that they made this movie with a very small budget. Or maybe they spent a good chunk of the budget in signing on the actors. I didn't even realize that this movie was based off a video game which might have explained the bad plot. Don't get me wrong, I'm a big gamer and I like movies, but games to movies adaptations have let me down many times. I would have to say though, the only good thing that this movie had were some of the special effects. Though they were cool, but it's nothing that we all haven't seen before. Oh, and the other cool thing was a prop, the boomerang. I can't remember the last time, I've seen a boomerang in a movie that made using it look cool.My verdict: the movie had a lot of potentials, but very weak executions.I kind of feel sorry for the director, Uwe Boll, (that's why I gave this movie a 4 and not a 3) after all, he is generally a nice guy who is misunderstood, but so many people out there hate him and all his movies (I'm still one of them), But for some reason I keep watching his movies I keep giving it a chance, hoping that this one will be THE movie that will change his reputation, but then again I rather not gamble on it and waste my time and money. And what I truly don't get is where does he get the money to make all of these movies? Is it from the videogames studios, if so, don't they know that he WILL kill the series with his movies?

reviews.review_title: Uwe - for the love of god open a variety store or something
reviews.content: & stop torturing the world with your horrible crap...this was brutal... the actors were somewhat decent actors in other movies... i mean, they've all done other good work.... how could they ALL suck so much under your direction?!?! the script - crap... costumes... my 6 month old niece could make better costumes for the krug just by taking a crap in her drawers UWE - u suck... seriously dude, just give it up...gawd.... i hate myself for wasting my time on this piece of crap... the worst thing is i knew it was going to suck because it had your name on it

reviews.review_title: A pretty nice movie!
reviews.content: I really liked this one. I looked into the movie, and a couple scenes really just catched me. After that, I just kept watching. It's a one thing lead to another, with a variety of characters, and a medieval setting.There are a lot of emotions that are visualized, that I really liked. The interaction, the banter inbetween the characters. The acting is very good. The story is simple, a one thing lead to another structure, built set by set, and such progresses throughout. It's a lot like a theatre play, but without it's limitations.The fighting scenes are also pretty good, there is plenty of action. The actors are doing a very good job, they are obviously veterans. The characters and their interactions are done well. The settings and decorations are very good, rougher, more like how old movies used to be.Overall, I really liked the movie.

reviews.review_title: Uwe Boll please stop making movies!
reviews.content: This is one of the absolute worst movies I've seen in recent years. The direction, the script and the actors, all of it was lousy.The story revolves around a man named Farmer, who after an attack by some evil monsters must find and rescue his wife as well as avenge his child. A somewhat unoriginal script perhaps but that's not the problem with this movie. The problem is that the script has awful lines and dumb twists. Combine that with Uwe Bolls non-existent ability to direct and you got yourself a new Lord Of The Rings for morons.I can't understand how actors like Burt Reynolds, Jason Statham, Claire Forlani and Ray Liotta could accept to be in this piece of crap. They probably got their cash from Uwe Bolls paycheck, who was just glad to be able to do another brain dead movie.Please Uwe stop making movies, you've already stolen two hours of my life with this snooze fest.

reviews.review_title: Not THAT bad...
reviews.content: I heard it's rep before I saw it, and I was honestly expecting a bad movie, but still... It had its highs and lows, like some of the fight scenes that look like something out of a Xena episode (and that damn boomerang), or the story that's almost becoming a cliché. The dialog on the other hand surprised me positively, as it wasn't the usual pretentious crap that appears in most fantasy films that as a rule use Old English... The story IS a bit lacking, almost as if there's going to be a sequel. All in all, definitely not a waste of time, enjoyable weekend DVD.Oh, one more thing... it was rather lacking in the comic relief department. What the hey, just one scene??

reviews.review_title: Why you should appreciate this movie
reviews.content: 8 for a 4 rated movie? yes. and i'll explain why. OFC, all of the below is IMO, so feel free to disagree. when you like adrenaline, when you like racing, when speed is of the essence... and u buy a jeep, you then will vote the wrangler as a 4 out of 10 point car? maybe some of you will... for the rest of you, i continue with this: this is a TALE... if you want a tale, with some pretty good actors and a nice story, with happy ending and a lot of action and fantasy, here it is. if you want realism, drama, strong characters, solid story line... i recommend you Kurosawa's movies, Kim Ki-duk's movies and actors like Pacino and De Niro...

reviews.review_title: Worst flick I think i've ever. Turned it off after a few minutes
reviews.content: Let me start by saying that I'm shocked Females under 18 rated it a 7.9? Based on what? Set it old England, some of the actors have English accents? I even heard (during the major fight seen at the beginning) after the arrow shot from the grey-bearded man, an "ancient" soldier say "come on man, let's roll". Hardly old English verbiage with an American accent.One of the worst films i've ever seen. BTW: During the same fight seen, you see the star actor, a fierce fighter, sprint at full steam into a horse (face first) and fall down. Horrible.With such films as "Transporter" under the belt of the main lead, you would have excepted at least a decent movie. This on the other hand is a joke and I took out the DVD after just a few minutes.

reviews.review_title: What was that?
reviews.content: I had to join IMDb just to say that was one of the worst movies I have ever seen. I am a Statham and Perlman fan, so I thought this should be worth a watch. My wife went to bed about 20 min. in and I suffered through the entire thing hoping for something good. Even the fight scenes were crap. How much money did the actors get for this embarrassing piece of #@$*! Not worth the effort to but into the DVD case. The costumes for all the characters were a bit over done, I liked the comment that Liotta looked like he raided Liberace's closet. And the final slice of cheese was the soundtrack. Uwe Boll should stop making movies!

reviews.review_title: Fun!
reviews.content: This movie wasn't high cinematographic art, but it was *fun*! It reminded me of my early days playing D&D. Though the rope-dancing elves and Ray Liotta's Tinkerbelle'esquire's flight was lame, Ron Perlman (as always) was amazing, and I absolutely love John Rhys-Davies. I was even impressed with Burt Reynolds, I quickly forgot that it even *was* Old Burt and enjoyed the character.I think what I really enjoyed was that all the actors seemed to be having a good time making this. That added to the amount of fun I was having. And the music was awesome.I saw it in July at FantAsia, and I'm planning on seeing it again now that it is in wide release.

reviews.review_title: Movie Review
reviews.content: Don't waste your dollar at red box, or 2 hours on cable viewing this mess. I am sure all actors involved in this project are ashamed for even appearing in this crap. Kill yourself before viewing it, you will have more fun than wasting time seeing this. The plot is horrible and the acting is terrible. I suspect it was in the movie theater for less than a weekend before being pulled for something better. If I could give it a negative 10 I would. Watching the news is more entertaining. The special effects are the worst, this movie appears to be low budget and not worth the time and energy to see. Save your time and money and see something else.

reviews.review_title: Someone needs to be shot
reviews.content: The only reason I voted three is because they had a good cast BUT a horrible director. This movie was filled with great actors the story was great just that they shoved a three part movie into one big waste of money. I recommend someone please remake this film. I KNOW for a fact that the actors are good. but who ever wrote the script and the people who approved this seriously needs to find a different job.First off the movie just rushed into the story no introducing the characters, and if this is following a book the Director and the writers should have known better than make this film. they should have beefed it up a bit. I'm a low class college student and I have a bigger imagination and a greater mind of putting this glob of dirt and making it into a master piece. Second of all rated PG-13 for intense battle sequences ahahahhaha. going to the Wal-mart bathroom is more battle intense. WOW the people who rated this movie should watch more movies. or less. ahaha I've seen more blood an action in a Disney Film. WTF!!!!If this so is a book and the book is better the author should has stopped production and made it the way it should have been!!!!!!

reviews.review_title: Lost of time... get a French movie.. less boring !!!!
reviews.content: I've took a look to actors, well it look great, Jason Statham, John Rhys-Davies, Leelee Sobieski, Ray Liotta, Burt Reynolds...But after couple of minutes... Wow the script was amazingly bad ! Total crap ! Sounds so weird & bad ! And what about Leelee Sobiesky ears !!!! I've always find her really cute & kinky... but she always got loose hair in other movies !!!! HORROR !!!! At a moment, I was just watching her ears and didn't listening to movie anymore ! Just hypnotized by her JUMBO ears ! Suggestion, don't spend a penny on this movie... but rent it only to see her ears... sorry but it a GREAT thing to see at least once in your life !

reviews.review_title: Statham as badass as always
reviews.content: Saw this at a recent screening. Story is very straight forward and the action delivers. Statham is good as the lead and Ray Liotta chews up scenery like crazy. Their final fight might not go down into the history of the best ones, but it's very original.F/x are mediocre at times, but overall well made. The krugs looked a bit much like cheap orcs, but there you go. I guess the director didn't have the budget Peter Jackson had for LOTR. Favourite bit was the fight in the woods. Dungeon Siege succeeds in action and characters, plus variety of the very good looking sets. Just don't expect shakespearan dialogues.I'm a major Jason Statham fan and while Chaos and Revolver pretty much sucked lately, this fantasy piece is him in best form again. It's all about the action and that's never a bad thing. Can't wait for Transporter 3 and Crank 3, but so long I was satisfied with Siege. Recommended for all the Statham geeks!

reviews.review_title: Just don't watch it...
reviews.content: This is honestly one of the worst movies I've ever seen. There are plenty of people here who agree, so yeah... just don't waste your time.Here are some of the things I hated most about it: This is supposed to be set in medieval Europe I assume. Why are there a bunch of Americans in Europe? Why are there only a just a few people with English accents? Did they really skimp on the budget that much?During the battle scenes there are moments where the music just... stops... while action is still going on in real time behind two characters saying lines that seem to further the story no more and certainly add nothing to the dramatic tension. It's like the movie just drops to the floor and shatters any momentum that might have been building up. This is just poor judgment on the part of the director in my opinion.Burt ReynoldsCirque de Sole in the trees Rubber suit monsters straight out of Power Rangers. I remember being especially amazed that a group of these monster bad guys standing around a catapult seem to be just waving their arms arbitrarily. Why? There were no enemies in sight. I mean, these bad guys are implied to have enough intelligence to operate a catapult but some how just can't keep their own limbs from wandering through the air without purpose. Inversely, how are monsters stupid enough to light themselves on fire and climb into a catapult to be launched at the enemy even able to operate a machine like a catapult? This movie is retarded.

reviews.review_title: Not bad enough to be good
reviews.content: Maybe I watch too many bad movies, but this really didn't live up to its terrible reputation... much to my disappointment.Dungeon Siege is a long, boring, by-the-numbers fantasy "epic" with a few good moments and a lot of poor choices. This makes it a bad movie, but not a BAD movie on the scale of Boll's previous disasters (Bloodrayne, Alone in the Dark) and therefore much less entertaining. Maybe he's learning? My point is: for people seeking another "so bad it's good" classic, I recommend you look elsewhere.The problem with Dungeon Siege is that the story and the acting are both fine(ish); it's the directing and editing that kill the movie. This makes it more irritating than funny, and aside from a few spots of ludicrous dialog (I dare you to make sense of Reynold's final speech!) it's more hum-drum than fun.Others have enumerated the films worst points already (Liotta!), so I won't repeat them. However I have to say: the hate for Matthew Lillard confuses me. He single-handedly made all of his scenes watchable. If every actor had been as entertaining as he was, this would have been a much, much better movie.Long story short: not bad enough to be funny, not good enough to be good, so don't bother.

reviews.review_title: An easy film to watch.
reviews.content: I'm surprised at the bad reviews, as I don't personally think it's a bad film. It's not a full on action movie that you often see Jason in, it had a lighter and more mystical side. It sort of lends itself to an older family film for the most part. Just a nice easy film to watch.

reviews.review_title: TEDDY FLIX REVIEWS -"In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale (2006)"
reviews.content: TEDDY FLIX REVIEWS -"In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale (2006)" -- This film was EPIC! RIVETING! DAZZLING TO THE SENSES! Director Uwe Boll threw in everything from numerous bloodless be- headings, Jason Statham's character, "Farmer", running across the shoulders of a dozen orc-like adversaries called Krugs, whom also voluntarily set themselves ablaze to be catapulted against The King, Burt Reynold's soldiers. The movie starts off just fine with brief scenes of the leading players in their respective scenarios: Liotta romancing Leelee with some sort of magical special effects going on; John Rhys-Davies (as a Magi and adviser to the King) sagely crying out "No!" as if it meant something; Statham, as a family man farming a field with his son when Perlman shows up as a friendly neighbor; Reynolds as the King and Matthew Lillard (doing his best to bring the 20th Century to the "middle ages time out of place" that is the setting for the film) as his cowardly / jealous of the throne Nephew. TWO THUMBS UP GO TO THE INTENSE BATTLE SCENES!! My favorite sequences consists of Krugs and fiery catapults, horses rearing up to crush opponents while being ridden by Wraiths controlled by Liotta's magic, gliding magical forest women riding vines like it's Xena meets Tarzan, only hotter chicks, and also the final duel between Statham and Liotta just ABSOLUTELY ROCKS! Teddy Flix say "5 stars baby ... nothing more, nothing less!" -- https://www.facebook.com/media/set/? set=a.10151901308699429.1073742285.518209428&type=1&l=1515b81720

reviews.review_title: Not Bad
reviews.content: While not one of the greatest movies I ever seen, it definitely wasn't the worst. Considering the bashing Uwe Boll gets I was expecting the movie to be a travesty along the lines of Blood Rayne, so I had very low expectations and was surprised. While it definitely could have been better with more effects and if the story had been drawn out and shown in a more epic way, like LotR or something similar it, it was passable. The story was decent, although rushed! The actors did a decent job with very little time to develop character depth. I do admit I am glad I didn't go to the theaters to see ItNofK, but it is a good rent. After playing the game, which I enjoy, I was disappointed that there wasn't more to it than what we got. Considering the other VG movies that have been made this is definitely a few steps up, but still along ways from the standard that it could have been with the story and history that the game already has. While I wasn't disappointed and did enjoy the movie I wasn't greatly impressed. Better than some of his other movies, but some nice improvements would be character development and a plot that doesn't move at light speed.

reviews.review_title: Great Film After Pizza and a LOT of Beer.
reviews.content: Where do we begin? I saw this film on DVD with a few friends after some terrible Chinese pizza and a lot of good Chinese beer. We have seldom laughed harder or longer for most good comedies we have seen together. Why?The script and casting is to die for. I mean every actor uttering every word in this film dies on screen; in an a mass suicide of actors uttering ridiculous dialog. Talk about being all over the place:There is a Viking funeral, Ninja warriors, Merlinesque English magicians, a touch of Saturday Night Fever and Goodfellas with Ray Liotta,(absolutely hilarious casting here),a Lord of the Rings quest, a borrowed plot line from The 13th Warrior (men dressed up as Orcs),another hilarious idea to cast Burt Reynolds as an ancient king,(I was waiting to see Sally Field as the Queen and it would have been perfect), forest choreography similar to Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon, and a bad imitation of Dennis Hopper by some second-rate actor.Other than that, the film was completely believable.The action sequences and production values were quite good; and fine for a video game. But this was supposed to be a movie with actors, direction, a plot, a script and a logical sequence. None of these are apparent in this turkey. But my friends and I had a grand old time lampooning just about every actor in every scene of this debacle. Just make sure you drink plenty of beer before you watch it.Arthur H Tafero AskMrMovies.com Senior Reviewer

reviews.review_title: It's Trash but it was fun! (not sober tho)
reviews.content:
After a good smoke and a few beer this Boll disasterpiece turns into a fun, cheesy and action overloaded flick to enjoy.
There's plenty of fights, cringy dialoque and terrible directing.
Watch it with a few friends on a good weekend and ignore the reviews.

reviews.review_title: What is wrong with you people?
reviews.content: This was fantastic adventure with OCR like creatures and wood spritesmagic shield armor bow AXES BREATH TAKING! I was blown away I no expectations, bu BOLL DID IT yes he did! BRAVO. It's lord of the ring lite and that just fine by me very epic wonderful story lines awesome bad guy by Ray. It was so great to see "gimli" once again. I love that man as an actor and always will GLORIOUS!!! DO NOT buy the hate. Please give it a chance it is fun. Must we need more than simple fun and very good battle sequences??? EXCELLENT! I would love to see him get the credit he deserves for finally knocking one out of the park. This movie erases all my bad memories of him. Give it a chance and don't allow someone else to make up your mind for you as if you were a sheep.

reviews.review_title: Tone Deaf
reviews.content: I read all of the posted comments after sitting through half of the movie. I agree with everything written, but I had to submit my own comment because No One addressed what I considered the worst aspect of the movie... the score! It was ear wrenching... I don't know who the composer was, but he should be banned from the movies. I could have done a better job when I was 10 on my keyboard! I'd have to place the Krug costumes a close second in offensiveness, to be followed with the dialog. I generally enjoy most of the leading actors in other movies. I know they can only feel shame and disgust for ever signing up for this stinker.

reviews.review_title: Yech
reviews.content: It is really hard for me to find a place to start counting the problems with this movie. Like many before, I was intrigued by the names that are in the film. But 10 minutes into it, it just got bad, then worse, then horrible. Music - beyond bad, Acting = terrible, Directing - wow, Costumes - jeez. I haven't had the pleasure of checking out the directors other films but after this, I will rush out and try to get them right away.... I have read several of the reviews on here and while I can tell some of the folks are joking with their high ratings, some are not. If you thought this movie was even close to good, you need to be stopped, just like the director. Although I have not been to check it out yet. I am firmly convinced, THIS MOVIE GAVE ME CANCER.

reviews.review_title: A Rambling Piece of Cheese
reviews.content: It has been a good long time since I saw a movie as massively, unintentionally cheesy as In the Name of the King. Lured into purchasing it on Blu-Ray as part of a batch offer, I already had my doubts about a film being marketed just on the basis of the lead having been in The Expendables. But seeing Jason Statham's hunky face on the cover made me walk into the trap regardless: I'm just superficial that way.
