After the purchase, I took better look at the director and saw the name Uwe Boll, in very tiny print. It was then that I knew for sure I'd been had.Uwe Boll is known for his ability to make bad movie adaptations of game franchises, such as Bloodrayne, Alone in the Dark and Far Cry. They are said to be generic and uninteresting at best, hilariously bad at worst. He once famously challenged his unflagging critics to take him on in the ring and settle their score man-to-man, apparently believing he could prove the quality of his work by punching a critic in the face. To be fair, based on his reputation I had always avoided his movies like the plague and had never given him a fair shake. But going by this movie, I should just have taken other people's word for it and spared myself two hours of low-budget mediocrity. The whole project is po-faced, misjudged and wobbly in all aspects from acting and script to special effects. Even the passionless soundtrack conspires to makes things drag.In the Name of the King – a Dungeon Siege Tale is based on a Role- Playing game I know nothing about and stars Jason Statham as Farmer, whose day-job is evident from his name. He has a son and a wife, but not for long, as soon they are both taken from him by the 'Krug', who look suspiciously like Trolls and were probably renamed to sound less generic. The Krug have a silly semi-gorilla walk with corresponding sounds, unconvincing bodysuits and never let you forget that there must be an actor inside, feeling very bad for himself. There is a magical mastermind pulling the Krug's strings (the ever-evil Ray Liotta) and his plan is to take over the land by getting rid of the king (a strangely tightfaced and overly made up Burt Reynolds), with help from the king's weakling nephew (Matthew Lillard, better known as Shaggy from the Scooby Doo movies). Not to spoil anything, but Farmer stops him. The end.I have left out some other characters like a magus/magician (the elsewhere admirable John Rhys-Davies) and Farmer's daddy substitute (the elsewhere fantastic Ron Perlman), but then none of them is especially memorable and they remain firmly 2D, if not 1D. One or two of the minor characters even risk travelling into negative space. It is the script's fault that people don't really say the things that would make the most sense in any given circumstance and that what does come out of their mouth sounds stilted, but since Boll is the producer and director, blame still lands on his plate. Watching the movie, I kept being tempted to reach into my television, yank out the script and do a quick rewrite. I also wanted to rewrite the beginning and get rid of a 'twist' that was probably intended as gritty and shocking, but really is just severely emotionally misjudged. It sets the wrong tone and shows that the makers are in denial about making a goofy fantasy action movie.Even though In the Name of the King is very long and feels like it, somehow it doesn't get around to putting in all the information you need to comprehend what is going on. For instance: there is a baffling group of semi-ninja warriors that just appear in the middle of a battle – on two occasions – without set-up or explanation afterwards. If only Boll had tightened up the story, got rid of some unnecessary characters and scenes, cut out about 30-45 minutes and used the extra budget to invest in a dialogue polish and better special effects This might have enabled them to make the fight scenes look like more than just a live roleplaying session in the woods. On the other hand, this would probably have meant we would have had to do without the awesomely silly tree-people who swing around on vines and are able to use them to attack people by way of unconvincing computer graphics.It's a mystery how Uwe Boll keeps getting the chance to make more movies. There always seem to be people willing to invest some money in his projects – as a tax write-off, perhaps – and some actors willing to spend time hamming it up and chewing the low-budget scenery. I don't understand why all of the at least somewhat known actors I mentioned didn't take one look at the script and at Boll's reputation and ran in the opposite direction. The sounds of agents getting fired must have been everywhere during and after the filming. Beefcake Statham fulfills the stoic hero part as best as he can, given the circumstances, but is a lot more fun in movies where he has a sense of humor than in flicks like this and The Transporter, where he is typecast as a frowning, one-note action man.To end on a positive note uhmm well, I guess some of the computer- generated vistas are actually quite nice and the Blu-Ray picture quality is crisp and clean. That's pretty much all I can come up with.Despite this movie being a massive commercial flop, a sequel starring Dolph Lundgren is in the works, once again directed by Uwe Boll. God(s) help us all.

reviews.review_title: Uwe Boll has done it again
reviews.content: Uwe Boll has garnered great fame as the worst director who has ever lived. it amazes me that he keeps getting financing for his horrifically bad movies. this movie will not let down those fans of his incredibly bad direction. its choppy, badly. the sound it horribly done. it bounces around so much you almost get seasick.i would have given it a zero, i gave it a three because Jason Statham was very good in it, as he always is, no matter what garbage hes forced to play in. i don't usually like Burt Reynolds, but he wasn't bad. Ray Liotta was very disappointing in this movie. i mean the others seemed to at least try. John Rhys-Davies was good as always, and surprisingly so was Ron Perlman. i mean he was great in beauty and the beast (the TV series), but I've never much liked him in anything else. here he seemed to have found a role he could play with, and i liked him in it. Matthew Lillard was excellent as always though he has become so typecast, and now appearing in a Uwe Boll film, its not a good move in my opinion for his careerbut basically, unless like me, you're a die hard Jason Statham fan, don't bother, i saw it for free, and i want my money back. it was that bad.rock on Uwe, your record for truly being a horrid storyteller stands strong :)

reviews.review_title: Not your average Knights tale
reviews.content: Now I walked in to this movie hoping to watch another peasant turned knight movie to avenge some cause. Yeah...WRONG!! This movie starts out good, it catches your attention. But things don't stay that way. This movie was meant for all of us who have nothing better to do with our time except waste it aimlessly. I mean, even i left wondering what could have been a better way to wasted those 2 hours, maybe peeling onions. I'll end with this spoiler...NINJAS in a Celtic setting. There were way too many inconsistencies in this film. I'd say that Narnia was more believable than this.

reviews.review_title: Cheesy and poor made
reviews.content: Despite of having a well known cast The acting, the fights, the plot, the dialogs are extremely stupid. their lineas and acting is poor, Jason does not know how to use a sword, the fights sequences and the costumes are a joke, But the worst of all is the cheap CGI and the Soundtrack/Music score that ls played in each scene.....

reviews.review_title: Not that bad
reviews.content: It's not that bad. The story is kinda cliché. The dialogue is some Skyrim NPCs talking. The fights are long. The Krugs' and Effects are made poorly. But, it has a solid cast which kinda carries the movie. I don't recommend watching it. I did it for the Bottom 100 movies challenge I created for myself.

reviews.review_title: I can't believe how awful this is.
reviews.content: Let me state for the record that I love movies, and I watch movies all the time. Fantasy, drama, horror, suspense, romance, sci-fi, you name it. This is one movie that I just couldn't watch all the way through. I knew this movie wasn't going to be that great, but man was I OVER-estimating this pile of crap.Horrible, horrible directing to good actors makes, for one movie at least, horrible horrible actors. Ray Liota should have NEVER done this movie. Same for Statham. LeeLee, well, she's not really that great an actress in the first place, so...John Rhys-Davies : I am saddened by your choice to be in this movie. You are one of my favorite actors, and you have just put the worst credit of your career into the books.The music was just god awful. Same with the costumes, especially the goblin-wannabes. The most obvious rubber suits I've seen since black and white movies.I don't normally comment on movies, but this one is just crap garbage. Uwe needs to be thrown out on his ass and black listed from EVER doing movies again. I mean, c'mon. How the hell do you bank roll the WORST director ever? Look at his history. Bomb after bomb after bomb. The deusche bag hasn't had a real money maker since, well, NEVER!

reviews.review_title: Not good, but you may watch it
reviews.content: Well, as always, I must first say that I rented the DVD, and watched it on a CRT TV of 29'.The movie is as almost all reviews says, I'm sorry. At most times it is laughable and hilarious. I must say I liked the idea of the movie during its first half, but then on the second half, it becomes very bad. Dialogues are at moments stupid and at others somewhat acceptable. Fight scenes are really bad, they are constantly cut and completely boring. Some other details about costumes and the world might be bad, but they were acceptable. But then, on the second half there are some things that you say... WTF. On the final battle there were NINJAS. No one knows where they come from, just appeared there and started to do some flic flacs and killing people. The tarzan girls from the trees jumping everywhere throwing tree's vines. The krugs seemed like the breed from an orc and a monkey. And Gallian really fails at being the evil mage of the movie. There are many fails about this movie, some makes you laugh, others makes you cry. Either way, if you have nothing to do, and just wanna see a movie to pass time by, it is acceptable. Otherwise, don't watch it.

reviews.review_title: Bad mix
reviews.content: This movie needs a new ediing, new music, new pace, basically a new director

reviews.review_title: No it is not "cheesy fun"
reviews.content: No it really isn't it's crap.!Rubbish acting horrible plot dialogue and direction. All shot horribly.Seriously. It is so bad. Jason Statham looks embarrassed. Ron Perlman is just laughable. They are just running around in dreadful costumes like some kid of dreadful middle England thing fighting some pig faced soldiers and fighting and fighting and more fighting which the women cook and feed the children. It's so horrible, cheesy fun is not this. This was meant to be serious. Oh my word!Avoid like the plague.How on earth do they get away with making this bilge I will never know someone has their hand in a deep pocket somewhere.

reviews.review_title: In the name of the king, we deserved to watch it...
reviews.content: Well... the first signs of the film is encourage us to leave this, but the brave ones is surely watch it.Uwe Boll as director, OMG get away! - Jason Statham as protagonist, come on! That actor, who only played one character all of his films, even on his parodies and he just do one thing: Look intimidating, clearly it is good one a poster or a silly action movie... but not here. Not in any demanding movie.Let's see plot, which is clichéd, with the expectation of one cliché, the inn, we can see all, return to plot: Krugs attacked kingdom, sacking the entire village of Farmer (Jason Statham in movie) and kill his son, taken his wife away. Farmer Daimon (I not remembered this, so I seek to his name) and few of his friends go away to release Farmer's wife.LOGICAL FAILS: Krugs have an army, right? They surely had their own guardians, why would think, that a small group able to enter their territory. The magi (in modern clothes) sent the Krug against King Konreid. The daughter of this king in a weird lover of this magi, in a small sketch we can see their relationship, which ended in fault. The King's army attacked the Krug in a forest, aided by the nymphs and some assassin like warriors... (both?) I do not know, exactly. The King died later, naming his lost son (omg cliché) as his heir. Two magi clashes as a low-budget version of Gandalf vs Saruman, and the king's adviser magi fallen. Farmer enters the castle, deal with the evil magi with his followers. Here we knew, that his wife pregnant with his second child, an heir to Farmer.Total eye spit to the original Dungeon Siege 1 - I missed Lady Montbarron as central character - I missed the Utgards - I missed the plot of Legends of Aranna - Clearly they mentioned Ebh, but this Ehb is very cheap compared to the game's Ehb. - I missed the Empire of Stars, the Giants... etc. - Where is the Seck? - Where is undeads, goblins?Thanks for nothing, Uwe Boll.

reviews.review_title: This is the greatest fantasy movie of our time
reviews.content: This movie has everything needed to be considered the greatest fantasy epic of our time (SPOILER ALERT). Krugs, dark magic, intrigue, Ray Liotta, ninjas, Braveheart, Burt Reynolds, women on magical vines, Gladiator, accents, Neo, and the best CGI since Van Helsing. Like Big Fish it is a father/son reconciliation story. Like Top Gun, it is a story of men at war (with Krugs lighting themselves on fire before being launched from catapults). Awesome.Every minute you watch this movie you will find yourself saying, "I can't believe what I am seeing. I can't believe what I am hearing. I can't believe that humans made this. This is why I am drawn to film."Poets sometimes talk of the "shock of recognition" that is in all great art--that "shock" you feel at seeing something familiar in a fresh way. A new perspective on a familiar scene. In the Name of the King embodies that kind of art. It is truly a film for the 22nd century mind.

reviews.review_title: "That was so bad I think you gave me cancer!" - Calculon
reviews.content: This film is truly awful (and therefore fully deserving of one star). I gave up watching after 30 minutes and I don't know how I managed to watch it for that long.It starts off badly with some terrible dialogue and music, and it goes downhill from there. The Krugs are as bad as everyone says and did I mention the terrible dialogue?Seriously, you could not pay me to watch the whole thing. Avoid at all costs.Also, if you want to erase the memory of Ray Liotta's worst ever performance then check out Narc, where he's at his best.

reviews.review_title: the progress of Boll is almost there.... this is an entertaining film worth admission
reviews.content: I can say I have grown as Boll has grown seeing all of his video game adapted films in theaters. I saw the terrible acting and decent action of House of the Dead, the lackluster plot(but progress) of Alone in the Dark, and finally the underrated and horribly businesses handled BloodRayne. So now here is In The Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale... and what do I think? Uwe Boll seems to be only baby steps away from becoming a solid "B" rate movie director, writer, producer, etc and this movie shows it. First off, the visuals through out show that Uwe Boll actually can control and emphasis his points on what he wants to do with the camera. The same plague seems to haunt Boll though. Poor conversations between the actors and terrible editing. The writing for this has gotten better, I still think BloodRayne was the best out of the 4, but the editing, especially in the beginning, is choppy. Now how about the acting? All over the place would be easiest way to say. Burt Reynolds as the King is off but I think everyone was cast well it's just that I don't think Uwe gets it or has yet to emphasis that vision as he has improved basically everything else. The music fits the mood, but how about the action you wonder? Solid through out just like his previous efforts. The ending is a bit weak and a little rushed it seems, but if there is two things I can't complain it is the visual work and the action scenes.Overall Boll created a film that killed my 2hrs and was worth admission. I can easily name a lot worse films that have released probably just in December.I think he is making the proper steps and I expect he will use a lot of what he learned to make Tunnel Rats a solid film.

reviews.review_title: 3 words.. "Is That It?"
reviews.content: OK, so seeing d movie trailer, dis title gave me quite a good impression and left me w/ d thirst of watching it.. i was like a mad man waiting for it to be shown in d movie house! d day came when i managed to borrow a copy of this film from my friend. The beginning is so boring and so is the whole story.. I was so disappointed w/ d flow of d film.. It could have been better.. It could have been shorter.. It could have been a good movie..the story has a lot of twists and turns w/c gave it a plus points 4 d viewers but d beginning was not fit for d film at all.. We saw a lot of titles like Daredevil w/c starts the movie 4m d end.. dis film was started at d middle part of d story.. no flashbacks (w/c is cool) no background (w/c is bad)..people who wants 2 watch dis film r quite curious whether it's like dungeons and dragons, Eragon, etc.. but it's something in between.. d fight scenes r not "matrix-like" (w/c will make d film s*** more, so it's good) but i was looking 4 d "gladiator-ish" fight scenes w/c will show d impact, brutality, and sad fate of those involved n d war..dis title is good but not as good as d trailer.. f u r hoping 2 see something w/c s packed w/ story, action, and drama this isn't a good film for u.. this film is a all about hierarchies and i would give it a 10 out of 10 if it is a documentary about d leadership of that fictional kingdom.. but it isn't.. sad 2 say..

reviews.review_title: Makes you appreciate J R R Tolkien so much more~
reviews.content: What a dismal, boring, lackluster piece of trite self-indulgence! Jason, what were you thinking?? If you ever wondered why Burt Reynolds retired, just watch him as the good king...OMG! This film was miscast, lacked a coherent story, a shameless ripoff of LOR and so brutally misdirected that my son and I both fell asleep half way through. Not since Lindsey Lohan (I Know Who Killed My Career) have I seen such a hack job done on a fairly high budgeted film. No need of spilling the beans here with anything that could give away the plot...because there was no plot! If you like watching ice melt or get off on root canals, well, tuck in and enjoy. I can't believe this guy is directing another film, something is rotten in Germany and it ain't the cheese. I think Ed Wood may have new competition for worst director and 'Plan 9 From Outer Space' may have a rival for worst film ever...only problem, this will never be considered camp or fun like the other.

reviews.review_title: 29 years is a bit much!
reviews.content: There's nearly a 30 year difference between Ray Liotta and Leelee Sobieski. Am I the only one totally grossed out by that? Other than that it's pretty terrible all around, especially given the star-studded cast. Go watch The Princess Bride (again) it will make you much happier.

reviews.review_title: In a word, cliché
reviews.content: If you want your classic fantasy movie, this is it. It's got a simple farmer, bad guys who ruin his life, good guys beat bad guys. It's nothing special. The plot is rather predictable and is not new at all, even the "twists" are predictable. There is really only two good actors in the entire movie, the cgi is half decent but in the wide-shots it's easy to tell. Props are basic but still well done. It's obvious that the director was attempting to imitate any number of movies, Lord of the Rings especially, but in the same respect, it's hard not to imitate one movie or another these days.I know I just said a bunch of... negative things about this movie, but I think it is still a half decent flick. If you watch it expecting a Lord of the Rings epic tale, you are going to be very disappointed - but then again there aren't many movies of that quality. Watch this movie and take it at face value. Don't try to look any deeper then what you see, because there really isn't anything more. Enjoy it for what it is. A nice little fantasy tale where the good prevails over evil.Btw if you were curious, I would say that you could watch this as a family or let your kids watch it, assuming they are not to young of course. There is nothing that is all to scary and the fighting sequences are gore free, you see maybe three people impaled on swords and a few lit on fire and a few others shot with arrows. There is nothing graphic, it's more of a "ouch that would hurt" kind of thing. Some of it even bordering on the ridiculous.

reviews.review_title: Horribly horrible
reviews.content: Please Mr Uwe Boll,.i do not hate you,nor do i like to watch and waste my time viewing these ridiculous movies you have been producing. In the name of the king?really???? Story lines is awful,chemistry of actors is so poor,graphic wise disastrous ,and as a whole....complete waste of time. As i do understand,most people watching an Uwe film,are not satisfied with what we expect as viewers. Lords of the Rings is a cult movie that cannot be copied in any way,not as IN THE NAME OF KING,or IN THE NAME OF THE KING 2,.I hope Mr Uwe will read this an understand the facts about making movies,or video games movies,.sincerely hope that i would not watch one of his movies again.

reviews.review_title: Oy!
reviews.content:
I really want to like this film . . . it has a great back-drop, a likable group of stars, a decent script that in other hands might have worked . . .Oy!Uwe Boll took all of that plus 50 million dollars and, well, failed to break through into mainstream fantasy cinema . . . he failed to make even a decent B movie!His shot-selection and cinematography were slipshod and in some case flat-out awful, his direction either 1) failed to get the best out of actors who normally give good performances or 2) forced their performances down the wrong path (Sobieski, Lilliard, Liotta) . . . and then he created a laugh inspiring climactic battle that including faux-ninja's, piss-poor 'Krugs' being fired out of catapults, some of the worst fighting scenes in recent memory and a whole lotta, well, just weird stuff . . .
The music did nothing to help matters, as it seemed almost appropriate at times . . . and then was either a screeching mess or completely inappropriate to the scene.Oy!

reviews.review_title: Actually really decent fantasy movie
reviews.content: Some really nice on location shots, great fight choreography, really entertaining battles. It's not the Lord of the rings, but fantasy movies are few and far between and this one is more than competent. The low rating is really inaccurate in this case.

reviews.review_title: Pathetic......
reviews.content: This movie was so bad it made bad movies look good!!! The sound effects seemed off and the creatures looked so fake. It was like a total rip off of Lord Of The Rings. I cant believe Ray Liotta, Jason Statham, and LeeLee Sobieski (Burt reynolds wig look like a squirrel humping his head)were actually in this movie. I hope they make a comedy spoof of it like they did epic movie and meet the spartans. I'm glad I didn't watch the rest of it like in the movie big daddy when the guy at the podium says "Not once in your incoherent ramblings did you make any sense and we are all dumber for having listened to you." Thats how I felt about this movie. I laughed at it so hard I almost peed my pants. God pathetic

reviews.review_title: Are we talking about the same thing
reviews.content: Ok this isn't the best of the best, but this movie definitely deserves more than the comments and ratings given.

reviews.review_title: Boring
reviews.content: The only reason I sat through this whole movie is to find the answer to one question. Is Uwe Boll really that bad? By the way the answer is yes. While most people hate this guy he has developed a small audience of arrogant people who say "Everyone is just jumping on the bandwagon". While many people are probably just hating on him because everyone else does he really is that bad. The story is your typical run of the mill sword and sorcery thing. The land gets attacked by monsters and it is up to one guy to save it, and there is also some subplot about a king and his son and a bunch of other sh*t I can't remember, but I didn't care because none of it was at all interesting. The characters are just bland cardboard cut outs with very little personality and are just there to fill in their roles. The acting is bad even from the otherwise good actors mostly because they have nothing good to work with and they were clearly just here for the money. Now you may be saying "well yeah it's a sword and sorcery flick. what did you expect?" I love this sub genre even the cheesiest of entries, but the problem is this movie is boring. The whole thing is played straight and there are no laughs, and the main characters doesn't have the charisma to carry this film because all he does is brood and fight. The action is awful for a couple of reasons the editing moves too fast making everyone disoriented, the creature effects look horrible, and the fighting is totally one-sided so there is no suspense involved. This movie isn't even so bad it's good, and after watching it you just feel like you wasted your time.

reviews.review_title: Don't watch it.
reviews.content: Where do I start? I watched this film on netflix after it being out for 7 years and I have to say, this is the first time I've ever heard of Uwe Boll. Making movies adapted from video games is a good idea but everyone knows that a game or film made by the counterpart always, and I repeat, always bad. They ruin the franchise. When the film started, I thought it was okay until it got to the first battle scene in Stonebridge, #1 I don't see a bridge and #2 there was only a house or 2 that was actually in stone. How awful. The bit where Statham's character slashes and 'kills' a krug, wheres the blood? How was he able to lift that ugly goblin thing? We know these characters have blood as we see Solana with some on her head, Gallain when stopping a sword smash onto his head, Duke stabs some general and wow, there's blood on the dagger but no, slashing in that universe means no blood for either the krug or the humans. Another question that popped up in my head, why where the krugs taking the humans, to be slaves? all i ever saw was them tied in chains sitting on the floor.'In The Name Of The King'. Okay what does that mean? 90% of the film was about Statham's character, we only learnt about him being the king right before his battle with Gallain.it's truly awful, I watched it because I thought it was interesting, hence the title name but nope, I will never again watch a movie by this awful director, WHY IS HE STILL DIRECTING?????????????????????????????????

reviews.review_title: Do you like turkey?
reviews.content: If you like turkey, this is the film for you. It's a turkey so massive it could probably feed a small country. I don't know how it is possible to make such a massive turkey of a film with such a great cast....I mean, that takes real talent!After watching this film my eye stung really badly. I had to go to the doctors, apparently i had turkeyitus! I think that if i watched this film again I might actually go blind. It has also spoilt my Christmas dinner, because every time I look at a turkey I can't help but think of this film...Do not watch it, for health and safety reasons.

reviews.review_title: One of those "Meh" movies.
reviews.content: Since I'm a fan of fantasy movies, I figured this was one I had to check out. I didn't expect too much after seeing the movies' score here on IMDb, and was neither proved wrong nor let down. I'll give the movie a 5. Sure, it will entertain you, but that's all there is. There are so many odd plot holes I don't even know where to begin. And, as another comment said, for some reason the movie seems to 'race' from one very LOTR-like fight to the other, often without a good reason to do so.The only scene I really liked was the Wizard battle. It's filmed and held in such an original way that it actually made me say that it is something that's actually worth the title of 'Wizard battle'.In the end, I suppose I can say the special effects were nice and not overdone. But that's about it. This movie isn't awful, but it's nothing special either. If you can get it cheap, save it for a rainy day, watch it once, and then discard it.

reviews.review_title: Nice trailer, but the movie is total loss of time...
reviews.content: I watched the spectacular trailer and I wanted so much to watch the movie. Thou even when I saw the trailer I was thinking that Jason Statham is not quite the guy for this kind of movies, the man's face is for action movies(like Transporter), you expect him any time to draw some pistols from his back and shoot the "krugs". Anyway, the movie was soooooo bad and I realized that since the beginning by the horrifying music which was scratching our ears, I thought there is something wrong with the speakers... but they were more than fine... and the torture continued till the end of the movie with the retarded characters. under-kinder-garden dialogs, really poor special effects and a totally predictable story which could have been done more interesting even by a fifth-grader!!! I will NEVER watch a movie again without reading the comments on IMDb first, I swear!

reviews.review_title: ?? Uwe Boll ??
reviews.content: This is a movie with good actors and lots of money but there it ends. The actors performance is tragic the only reason you know they are good is because you have seen them in other movies. The story is bad really bad the effects and fighting ain't good either. Like all Boll's movies you are astonished how it could get so bad.If he isn't trying to make them bad its'truly remarkable. And for the one's of us that love's games and want to see them as movies it's tragic that he get's them.I have no clue how this totally talentless person gets money and actors to participate in his crappy movies?

reviews.review_title: Brainless fun!
reviews.content: This is my first comment regarding a movie here but I felt like carrying the flag on this one. Everybody makes fun of Boll for being a bad director and mostly I agree with them. What I like about him though is the spirit with which he makes movies. When you look beyond the terrible acting and cheap special effects, the unconvincing script and the -most of the times- unfitting music you will see some glimmers of ideas so fresh and original that could be found only in some independend films. Dungeon Siege has those in tons. A magi duel that puts the Saruman-Gandalf one to shame. Some of the best battle moves we've seen lately. Gritty and realistic environments. And of course a spectacular end battle between the hero and the villain. I don't mind that DS was based on a video game, having played the game I found almost no connection and that's a good thing since usually game scripts are thin and transparent. Well, the movie script is thin and transparent too but at least it makes an effort to add some spice. Even the elves are different from the cookie cutter archetype, and they finally are portrayed like the brats that they are. All in all, I really enjoyed DS, it gave me some belly laughs and some great action scenes. Oh, and it has Ron Pearlman in it so add 2 more score points for it.

reviews.review_title: Great CGI, nice stunts, and OK make-up...
reviews.content: I just saw this movie - and I liked it! Mainly because of the nice, imaginative and well-done CGI. Fight scenes and stunts are actually also quite good. OK - the storyline is definitely a B-film worthy (comparison to Tolkien would be blasphemy!), and the all-time present muzak is terrible and sometimes completely unnecessary. However, filming is technically quite good with extremely high contrast (which I really, really like a lot!). I also like the many close-ups of the beautifully make-up'ed, well-known actors (Stratham, Reynolds, Rhys-Davies, Liotta, Perlman, Sobieski). I did not know that this film had got so many bad reviews. I write this, because I think it deserves a slightly better reputation...

reviews.review_title: Yawn! Better than Eragon...but not by much
reviews.content: If you can stay awake through the whole movie, you'd actually enjoy a picture that is very underwhelming. Congratulations. For a movie that's based on a computer game, I have to admit that I didn't expect much, and I wasn't disappointed. I actually played the game this movie was based on, and I really don't see any connection between the two, either. It's like they pulled all the fantasy scripts floating around Hollywood, picked one, then rewrote it with some "Dungeon Siege" names, then slapped the game's name on it, hoping to pull in some dough from fans or something (and just to be clear, I watched it because I like Jason Statham, not Dungeon Siege). For some rather big (has-been and B-list) names, I expected better. The script is just pathetic (whoever wrote it failed miserably with the dialog), the action is okay (Lord of the Rings, Braveheart, etc. were much better for army vs. army fights), and the special effects could have been done on my computer at home, probably.I'd recommend renting Red Sonja or Conan instead of this. At least you'd be watching a couple classics that way.

reviews.review_title: Worst P.O.S. movie ever....gimme back my 7 dollars
reviews.content: I have never seen a movie that literally put me to sleep in the first 10 minutes of the movie. The acting...terrible. The story....terrible. The stars in the movie....terrible. Jesus! WTF were you all thinking...CASH GRAB. Look I am no professional, but I've made better looking pieces of crap than this movie. It was like they took one of the writers from Lord of the Rings, and one from Troy....held a gun to their head and said write me a movie in 30 minutes or else you will die.With that said, some of the fight scenes were cool, but it is hard to take either Ray Liotta or Burt Reynolds seriously. They seem to play the same character as they did in previous movies...only in mid-evil clothes.Avoid this movie, unless you are suffering from insomnia and want to get some rest.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as assumed
reviews.content: I'm not a generalist and I don't particularly love one particular genre. I tend to give people a chance. I know it's the running gag to generalize Uwe Boll's movies, but I gave the man a new chance. So I watched this movie. Although I agree with a lot that has been sad about the acting and the bad script, I actually enjoyed watching this movie even tho the script/dialog was often pretty bad. The pace was quite alright. There was some completely out-of-line unrealistic stuff going on as well, but I didn't mind it that much because it was a fantasy movie anyway. The special effects were pretty acceptable as well. One thing I really got annoyed with was the music. Not that the music was particularly bad, it was in abundance. Far too much movie under far too many scenes.The action was pretty cool at times I must say. But just what was going on with these ninja's... Jason Statham stood his man. The actors did what they could with the script. I wouldn't say I enjoyed the acting a lot, because most of it was a bit heartless and more forced to the maximum achievable with the bad directing and script. The story itself wasn't that bad, it was average to my taste.I found John Rhys-Davies one of the best actors right next to Ray Liotta. Jason Statham was the good old himself and Ron Perlman did what he could. Leelee Sobieski wasn't bad either.One thing I can't get my mind around is how Uwe keeps getting enough funds to make another movie. You would say someone would learn from the critics, but Uwe clearly doesn't. He needs to leave the directing to someone else, because he clearly lacks giving the movie a soul, a heart and subtle nuances.All in all I gave it a 5. Its alright to watch on a late Saturday night if you like fantasy.

reviews.review_title: worst movie I've seen in 10 years
reviews.content: wow, just wow. I expected it to be bad and it blew away my expectation. I was ready to enjoy it, for it's campy LOTR rip off that it was. I blame the director 100% good actors delivering their worst performances. Damn, so so terrible it's at least so bad that it's a train wreck, if only it weren't a 45 minute too long train wreck.There were thing thrown in there for the sack of why not, such as in medieval times, they through in ninjas randomly, it makes no sense and they don't advance the plot at all. The mindless enemy had war machines like catapults but the smart humans have nothing but foot soldiers not even cavalry. It's called dungeon siege but there is no siege on a dungeon that name is only from a video game of little relevance to the movie.

reviews.review_title: Power Ranger Quality
reviews.content: From the beggining something was off. Can't be the acting, they're too good. The script, the filter on the camera? Surely part of the answer.But then it was just obvious that the direction was amateurish at best. When I first saw the orchish-like beasts moving like the aliens in Power Rangers that was the final sign it wouldn't be getting better.Statam gets rid of the 5 orcs then runs to aid his friend. "What took you so long?" Really... that's the best line they could think of? Might as well put in "I'll be back" somewhere in there.It got worst when they horsebacked to the village to a full scale battle. Badly choreographed battles, slow and telegraphed moves while enemy just waiting there to get killed, no blood, to swords or spears piercing through. Only slashing just like a low budget B movie. And again with the yellow filter.Comes Ray Liotta's character to finish me: dressed and groomed like a pimp from the dark ages. His telepathic control from a distance while in a cylindre of smoke was really, really kitch at best. Why does he always have the same hair cut in all movies? He looked like Henry Hill from Goodfellas in a bathrobe.The whole 24 min had a Power Ranger, original Star Trek, Excalibur feel to it.Now, Power Rangers was low budget and they played with it with full knowledge. Star Trek was in the 70's-80's and a pionneer in its kind and Excalibur was a great movie.... in 1981.40 years later, a star studded cast and I can't watch more than 24min eventhough I was expexting a "turn off you head" type of movie.Quite pathetic.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie ever.
reviews.content: do not watch this movie ever... When I saw the previews for this movie I thought it was going to be good. I mean It was a Jason Statham movie, and I have seen his movies before, and they were good. Then when I put it on, and saw Ray Liotta? I was thinking sweet, LOTR meets Good Fellas. And then Ron Pearlman? Wow, this cast was becoming great. Then the plot kicked in. And it was by far the WORST MOVIE I have ever seen. And that's saying something, I have over 400 DVDs in my collection. I mean, It has all been said, Shitty (Sorry for the profanity, but it's the only possible way I can describe it.) There were holes in this plot than on the surface of the moon. About half way through the movie when you find out the king (Burt Reynolds) Is Farmer's(Statham) father. I mean, it doesn't even explain how this came to be that neither of them knew this. I tried to enjoy this movie, but it was so bad I caught my dog trying to kill himself after. I seriously don't think this movie should never be watched for no reason what so ever. I wouldn't even recommend it for convicts on death row as a form of punishment. I just can not comprehend how this movie came to be, I am just thinking that the actors and actresses just wanted enough money to get a new Ferrari. That is the only explanation why anyone decided to sign on for this movie.

reviews.review_title: A tasty fairytale
reviews.content: A good surprise. I knew Dungeon Siege not from the video game, but from the comics, and I enjoyed this movie version. The script is nothing particularly new, but the acting is decent and the photography (which wants to imitate Peter Jackosn's "Lord of the Rings") is not bad at all. I liked Ron Perlman and to see Burt Reynolds as a sort of old King Arthur was a pleasant surprise. Statham is not Mortensen, for sure, but he's not a bad choice for the role. Orcs like creatures, castle's dungeons which remind very much Saruman's tower, magic forests and an evil sorcerer (even if Ray Liotta is the only one I would not have chosen to play this part)gives to the movie a Tolkienanian air which I liked. The secret is not to take the whole thing too much seriously.

reviews.review_title: If you're into absolute crap, see this film
reviews.content: Horrible. I don't know how else to describe this movie.Thanks to good old' Uwe Boll, king of the video game-based flop, even this cast looked like a B-list acting crew. I've heard better dialog and seen better special effects on Cinemax late-night TV-MA.Quite a few others have already dropped more witty comments on just how bad, yet strangely perplexing, this movie actually is. I wasn't sure if I was supposed to be laughing or crying (or laughing so hard I cried) during some of the more dramatic scenes.Here are a few random bits from the movie: When Claire Forlani finds out that her parents and son have been killed, the wails she let out sounded like they were sound bites from a really bad porno.Reynolds, Perlman's death scenes... Wow. In the blink of an eye, you go from dying to camera on another actor and then back to a dead Reynolds/Perlman. No dramatic speech, no final breath. One second they're talking about something mindless and the next they're dead.Liotta's death scene. "Oh no, there's a scratch on my neck! I should roll my eyes back in my head and fall over stiff as a board, dead." - The tree women. What was the point of having them at all? - The costumes of the bad guys looked like rubber suits with handfuls of mud stuck onto them.Were they all supposed to have different accents? I wasn't sure if this was supposed to take place in England or Alabama.Take those few things and throw in a terrible plot, worse editing, an uninspired cast, and Uwe Boll and you get yourself a great big steaming pile of cow dung.Way to crank out those blockbusters Uwe! You the man!

reviews.review_title: Loved It
reviews.content: While neither original or inspired I loved this movie. It was exactly what it was supposed to be. In the Name of the King was based off a game that I liked playing. It translated well to the big screen.

reviews.review_title: Possibly the greatest movie ever made.
reviews.content: I went to this movie expecting the worst, because of Uwe balls previous work i was a little hesitant, oh how i was wrong, the story is about a man named "farmer" who has to run around all day killing people to save his beloved wife, oh how he loves her so very much. you will never forget the courage, the bravery, the love in this film. not to forget the special effects and dramatic action, Uwe bell has truly changed the way i will look at life, and I'm certain he will do the same for you. Hollywood will change because of this film, the impact it has on you, oh dear lord thank you, thank you for everything! be sure to take all your friends and loved ones to see this movie, I'm sure after the 2 hours 30 minuets they will thank you.thank you Uwe Bull, for your outstanding directing skills and ability to spend money wisely.

reviews.review_title: not bad but it is Jason statham
reviews.content: Jason statham is not Shakespeare or to be taken seriously - this is just a good old fashioned fantasy action adventure film - yes it's weak but it's entertaining and predictable but good fun. And a bit different to his London underworld crime dramas - the battles are good and yes the Krug creatures are a bit odd but overall it's a family film too . Little bit of love and magic. I dont know why people expect so much - it's basically a made for TV movie and if you dont expect too much then you wont be disappointed. Just ignore the bad reviews and negativity and enjoy it for what it is ! Entertainment.

reviews.review_title: Don't do it.
reviews.content: This is simply one of the worst movies I've seen in years. The person I was there with wanted to walk out about 2/3rds of the way through, but I convinced him that we should stay since we already put so much time in. Here is a spoiler: They don't wade through any sewers. Every other fantasy cliché is covered.I get the feeling some of the bigger name stars asked to be killed off. Some of the deaths just happened because they were tired of writing for the character. The only one who looked like they were having fun was Jonathan Rys-Davies, probably because it is his bread and butter. Even Ron Pearlman looked uncomfortable up there. It would be nice to see more fantasy movies, but not like this. Please not like this...

reviews.review_title: I was surprised
reviews.content: OK, so this isn't Lord of the Rings, as everyone seems to compare it to. Get past that folks. Nothing will compare to that trilogy for YEARS to come. However, In the Name of the King was NOT a horrible film as everyone makes it out. Now, that doesn't mean it is a "Great" film, either. I would definitely say it was an "Okay" film.I can't stand Uwe Bowle. He is a joke when it comes to movies based on Games. However, a game like Dungeon Siege is perfect for him. He has a basic premise, and a very open plot to work with. You can't screw that up. Honestly, he didn't. This movie is FAR better than some of the drudge that Sci Fi channel has put out over the recent years. This is also leaps ahead in quality to previous Bowle film's.Yes, the acting was not gripping, and the action was a little "eh", but again, it was better than some low budget fantasy movies.Look at it this way, there was a solid beginning, a meaty middle, and an actual finish to this film. Bowle referenced towns and locales from the game from time to time, he maintained a basic drive and purpose for the enemies, and kept the heroes on track with their purpose. This movie did indeed hit on Fantasy Movie cliché's, but they managed to work well enough.Now, I know some will say a "5" is to gratuitous, but if this was NOT a Bowle film, would people actually have rated it higher? I am sure they would. Again, I am NOT a Bowle Fan. Alone in the Dark was not up to par, Blood Rayne was WAY to far from the plot of the game, and House of the Dead was dead in the water. In the Name of the King was enjoyable for the most part. Get over it. Just be glad he will never do Metal Gear Solid!

reviews.review_title: An Improvement
reviews.content: Having seen House of the Dead and Alone in the Dark I only rented this to give further credence to my hatred for Uwe Boll . . .However, instead of what I expected I saw a decent fantasy story, assembled in an acceptable, albeit inexpert way. The first point of note is the choice in editing. Simultaneous action scenes spliced together are common in this genre. The quiet scenes occasionally also spliced in do not fit and would be better placed afterwords, or before, by themselves. The restraint of emotion in certain scenes is in poor decorum for the material covered, typically with our heroic members. Contrastingly, Liotta and Lillard are jarringly insane, to the level of Shakespearean madness, without the decent dialog to back it up.The number of characters makes the development far too sharp (I already just used "jarring"). Honestly this would have probably been better as a mini-series.The point that I must make though is this: this film is decent enough as entertainment to receive detailed criticism. It is only a few solid points off of being good. It is far short of the epic that a $60Mill budget would demand, but still acceptable.Filmamker is showing improvement.

reviews.review_title: Abomination to all fantasy fans
reviews.content: Monster costumes so rubbery the swords bounced on impact, characters so clichéd Disney are suing, and a script so badly written even autocorrect gave up. I did too. So should you. The director obviously did.

reviews.review_title: Truly one of the most disappointing things I have seen
reviews.content: In the pursuit of a good waste of a couple of hours on a Saturday afternoon I sometimes go for a movie that the plot may not excite me that much but at least there is some action/good fight scenes (you know, a guys movie) Not to mention that Jason Statham is an actor who is known for delivering a good performance. The movie was a huge waste of time, it seemed to rip off (poorly) many characteristics of the lord of the rings. The real sad part about this movie is how many big names there are in this movie, but it was just not enough to save it. If you are thinking about seeing this movie do yourself a favor, read a book. Take a walk. Almost anything is better than seeing Ray Liotta act the same as he does in every movie he has ever made.

reviews.review_title: A Great action adventure - A Big screen Movie of Knights and Kings!!
reviews.content: The screening blew me away - What a GREAT movie! This is a Big Screen winner. If you liked the Lord of the Rings saga this movie is bound to revive you. It is an adventure and some. You must see it - indeed you must stay tuned for Jan 2008 and get ready for an adventure!! The movie takes you back to a time we have all dreamed of a time of knights and kings, great courage and noble deeds, wizardry and black magic. based on the popular video game Dungeon Siege the remake of the game is astounding. A must see really!! It is a movie for the whole family to watch but you have to see it on the Big screen the CGI is fantastic but not overdone, it really is the action that just never stops. Complete with amazing performances from the legends of film, the likes of Burt Reynolds, Ray Liotta, Jason Stratham, Mathew Lillard, Ron Perlman, Will Sanderson and the super HOTT Kristanna Loken!!

reviews.review_title: An improvement from his earlier films, but not enough.
reviews.content: Where to start. I am very much aware of Uwe Bolls work when I unfortunately found myself watching House of the Dead a few years ago. I found myself thinking, "how did this film get funding?" I of course found out eventually how the swine does get his funding but, as they say, is a separate issue. Despite the fact that I had reservations before even seeing the film I decided that the guy deserved at least one more chance. So I watched it.Now first off, if this film had been presented to me in a different capacity, say for example, a made for TV film for sci-fi or something some of things wrong with it could probably be forgiven. However, given that this film had a cinematic release one must seriously question the quality of the film.The main premise of the film is dire. A clunky script laden with horrendous clichés didn't much help either. The acting (considering that the calibre of the leads) was surprisingly bad. Burt Reynolds, Jason Statham, Ron Perlman, John Rhys-Davies, Claire Forlani, Ray Liotta, Matthew Lillard, Leelee Sobieski. I mean, just look at that list. Between them they have starred in some amazing films over the years. How a director can make all of them act so badly is an achievement in itself. I can't think of a single reason to justify why any of them decided to make this film unless a) they all have very bad agents, b) the original script wasn't that bad AND they'd never heard of Uwe Boll or c) money. Sadly I think it might be C.The "make up effects" (if you can call it that) of the monsters was almost laughable and very much like what you would see on something like Hecules or Xena back in the late 90's. They looked dated and poorly designed.To be fair on the plus side, some of the cinematography was pretty good, the action sequences (minus the dodgy monster thingys) were also pretty good. All in all the whole thing felt like a bit of a pantomime, something tongue in cheek. At the same time however, it felt like the film wasn't intended to be funny and that it just ended up that way.So, all in all, a generally poor film overall. However I would say, if this were a TV movie, a lot of what is wrong with the film could be forgiven. But it isn't a TV movie and you won't forgive it.Sorry Uwe, better luck next time. And in all fairness, this could be seen as progress.

reviews.review_title: this movie was awesome
reviews.content: This movie was seriously good i mean it had the best named villain ever the "rug" and then kluged people to death while the Transporter was a farmer that knew martial arts for no reason and kept owning the hell out of the rug and chopping off heads with junk and that guy from good fellas was trying to rule the world for some reason to finally rid the world of the bees who hate his honey. seriously this movie was great not a joke... everyone should see this now if you are a fan of things getting there heads chopped off and the Krug being used themselves as flaming catapults see this movie. the only thing bad to really say about this movie is that Burt Reynolds made an awful king he sounded whiny and and shaggy from that big brown dog was in it and was a bad guy who was extremely flamboyant and hilarious because he kept asking for dog snacks and cannon ball run wouldn't give it to him so he decides to try and kill him and take over his kingdom so he can have all the scabby snacks in the world the plot tries its best to be deep but fails don't watch the movie for the plot i couldn't tell you what it was about and i watched and loved it but seriously watch it cause the action is top notch.. I will be buying this movie as soon as it comes out.

reviews.review_title: And yes! You did it again Dr. Boll...
reviews.content: When I watched you on gametrailers you sad that people should judge you after they watched Dungeon Siege. So I am here now to tell you it was awful and you are the worst director ever. When those "scary" monster soldiers :D attacked Statham... it reminded me at those C category fight scenes from Hercules: The Legendary Journeys, but even that was much better than this... There was not a thing I liked in this movie. You achieved that a bunch of good actors signed for your movie and even with their support you just F it up again. Go and direct a porn, maybe you will not mess it up like all the other movies you directed... or maybe you will. I would not be surprised.

reviews.review_title: Worst film
reviews.content: I believe this is the worst film I have ever seen with Jason Statham in. Acting by all was terrible, graphics terrible. I would not recommend this to anyone, unless you are finding it hard to go to sleep, this will definitely help.

reviews.review_title: It more cinematically pleasing to hit your head into a wall
reviews.content: In 2008 Jason Statham was once the momentary baron of bad ass in that one film that transported him, but now all his shows close on opening night. Things turn around when he's visited by the neurotic accountant Leo Bloom, who proposes a scheme tailor-made for producers who can only make flops: raise far more money than you need, then make sure the show is despised make sure the show has not even sure that was a plot. . No one will be interested in it, so you can pocket the surplus. To this end, they produce a Fartasy called In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale written by escaped Doug Taylor (screenplay) Jason Rappaport (story) .... Then they get the insane Uwe Bollto to direct. Finally, they hire as leading wallpaper Burt Reynolds to show he is willing to be drunk for money

reviews.review_title: Just die Uwe Boll
reviews.content: I unfortunately watched this movie thinking it would have been a faithful adaptation to the games I love. GOD AND PEOPLE SAY DUNGEON SIEGE 3 BAD. This film not only is completely unfaithful, but it also manages to rip off The Lord of the Rings. It has terrible effects, bad acting, a confusing plot the editing is out of order oh and IT HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH THE GAME oh wait the land is called Ebe THAT'S IT. Seriously who lets this guy make this movies they're a disgrace to the games they're based on. I'd give this a -10/10 if I could.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely one of the worst movies I've ever seen
reviews.content: I mean are we not supposed to notice that most of these guys have no English accent? The dialogue was horrible. Completely ripped off Gladiator and GOT. A MUST NOT SEE! How do some of the world's best actors agree to such a horrible script?

reviews.review_title: It was so bad I wanted to cry
reviews.content: I just lost 2 hours of my life watching this movie that I can never get back. I love medieval time movies. So we watched this one. About 10 minutes into it we were thinking uh oh, this is gonna suck. 30 minutes later we were contemplating fast forwarding through it to see if it ended up getting better. But were afraid we would miss some vital element in the movie and then it would be even worse than if we could just watch it straight through. It even had an all star cast! Actors that do very well & I enjoy watching. The dialog was painful to listen to as the actors did what that could with an awful script. The special effects were, well there really weren't any. Unless you consider the stuff on the original Star Trek special effects. Basically it was Robin Hood Men in Tights meets Lord of the Rings meets Braveheart...then take away money for scenery & costumes & add horrible dialogues and you've got it! This producer guy, Uwe Boll, was crazy enough to make a part 2 & a part 3 of this movie also but the 2nd & 3rd time around he try's to throw in some time travel!

reviews.review_title: very good
reviews.content: This is an excellent movie. I'm my book rates as one of the best fantasy movies ever. The cinematography is excellent! You truly have to appreciate artistic films to enjoys this! Do not listen to the poor reviews. See this movie and you will probably not regret it. The scenery was excellent, I really enjoy a well choreographed movie with a artistic flow such as. The effects were great and the colors were as well.My only beef was that some of the acting was a little lacking, also the lack of a consistent accents is an issue. The other thing is casting Bert Reynolds as a main actor in anything is a mistake especially a epic movie. The main villain is also a annoying actor that could have been played by someone else.

reviews.review_title: Yes, it's really not that great
reviews.content: The acting is really bad. The beasts are human in very stupid costumes. No CGI, no great special effects. Just a bad script.

reviews.review_title: Astoundingly Terrible
reviews.content: As soon as I saw the preview for this movie, I just knew it would be terrible. Let me just say this though: if this movie was first aired on the Sci-Fi Channel, I wouldn't have expected anything less. Jason Statham is a good actor, but he was terrible for this role, as were most of the people cast for this movie. That being said, they aren't all terrible actors. Leelee Sobieski was decent, John Rhys Davies and Ron Perlman all did pretty well with their roles. On the other hand, Burt Reynolds, Matt Lillard, and Ray Liotta were so terrible, it almost made me weep.OK, so apart from the horrendous acting, there are many other terrible things about this movie. The costumes and sets were pretty bad. The costumes of the enemy, the "Krug," (this is the noise people make while vomiting during this movie) could have passed off for the Putty Patrol from the original Power Rangers. I actually flinched every time I saw someone walking on the sets, unsure if they could hold the actors weight. They looked like a middle school, shop class project. The musical scores for this movie actually upset my stomach. They are mostly done by a string orchestra, and sound almost the same throughout the entire movie. It's not so much music as it is noise, and the noise is close to the sound of nails on a chalkboard. There were so many things that were stolen from The Lord of the Rings movies (ehem, Gimli) that Peter Jackson is probably going to be whining and postponing his next movie because he isn't getting royalties from this one.I can't and won't recommend this movie to anyone unless Brightlight Pictures pays me to. If you want to save some money, don't see this movie ever...

reviews.review_title: in the name of god..someone please stop Uwe Boll from making anymore movies
reviews.content: I just managed to get through this god awful movie. Absolutely horrific.Again with the video game adaptations.When will Hollywood learn its lesson? I must say Uwe boll has once again managed to scam money from somewhere, then convince a fairly decent cast to play in this awful movie that tries to be like the lord of the rings but fails miserably. I suppose Boll has his own little obsession with Lord of the Rings , every shot in the movie looks like its been stolen from the trilogy of the rings. The Krugs or whatever they are called are a miserable attempt to look like Orcs. Gallian's domain also tries to look like its Mordor but also fails miserably. The worst of all were those female forest warriors who remind you of the Elves but stupidly are swinging about like tarzan and while doing it they have this silly pose you expect peter pan to have and not the elves.I always hated Uwe boll movies but this one takes the prize. Why do they keep letting him direct this stuff? Its not like Hollywood is running out of good scripts and good directors. Don't watch it. Nothing in this movie is original or even close to that. don't waste your time on a piece of garbage that has no characters no plot and certainly no entertainment value what so ever.

reviews.review_title: It was everything I expected.
reviews.content: Uwe Boll has gotten a lot of flack. All of it deserved. I had no idea this was his movie until the film started. However, I found that it proved that he CAN make a decent flick. As soon as I found out it was a Boll picture the bar dropped considerably. The cgi was stunning for the most part (admittedly, there were a couple of bits that could have used a touch of refinement), and the action sequences were quite well choreographed. I was definitely surprised at such a large, well-known cast of heavy hitters, all of whom put in a good performance (though I don't think any of them will be getting awards for this film.) Jason Statham is one of my current favorite actors, and I find that he did a great job in a non-modern piece. Give it a try, go see it once, and don't hold the bar too high. It's a good film, just don't expect it to be great.

reviews.review_title: Whoever wrote the musical score was tone deaf
reviews.content: It has quite a good story line, the actors tried their best, Lord of the Rings it isn't, however it had promise but the god-awful music spoils it. It plays all the time - very loud. It sounds like a room full of musicians tuning up. I agree with others, Uwe Boll must be blackmailing half of Hollywood to be able to get so many names to act in it and he himself get to direct it. I watched the Russian version, please somebody tell me other versions don't have this music. I couldn't watch this in a theatre if you paid me. I watched it on the TV screen and that was bad enough. It needs someone to remake it with a director that can direct and someone who can write music!

reviews.review_title: like a movie finished in 2 weeks
reviews.content: this movie is not particularly bad but the only problem seems to be the lack of budget . although the story is good and cast is alright but the movie lacks thrills due to cheap costumes and unoriginal looks of the kungs. instead of looking horrible they look comical. even then if u can forgive the director for these shortcomings i am sure u will enjoy this flick. jason stathom is the main stay of the movie. though plot has many holes but all in all a good action movie with not much to think about and not to go in depth. but just sit back and see what they offer without asking why and how this happened. coz u will never get the answers to ur questions. u will wait expecting them to be answered but the movie will finish leaving u curious and even frustrated. so don't go for this if u have a habbit of understanding movies.

reviews.review_title: I'd rather comment on it than watch it
reviews.content: It's on my t.v. right now...about 3 feet away. I can hear some dramatic music, I think someones dying. I'm not really interested enough to turn my head to the left check though. I'm on hour two of this 3 hour snoozefest. It looks like everything was shot in the same forest clearing and they just keep walking over the same ground over and over and pretending to travel. Also due to some really choppy editing characters are in completely different locales instantly. It's like they just keep teleporting from shot to shot. And the main character's name is "Farmer", it just sounds stupid. Ray Liotta has spent the last 90 minutes crouching in some mystical digital hurricane flashing his goofy 1980's sideburns dressed as a wizard. I didn't know that there were wizards from New Jersey. There's this one point where a monster lights himself on fire, climbs into a catapult and is launched into a tree trunk, gets up and hugs someone until they both immolate. That's actually a pretty good analogy for how I assume this movie was made. Worst of all Jason Statham does next to no karate in the film. What a waste!

reviews.review_title: Oh my god ?!!!
reviews.content: People don't waste your money on this movie. Maybe download it from the internet (in case you love J.Statham and you simply have to see every movie he played in, like i do :)) When i saw this trailer it looked so promising but now i am so pi*sed. I just watched the movie and i simply had to comment it (i have never did it, i even had to register on this page to comment). Actors jokes (expect Statham and Reynolds, and only cool stuff were the dryads, never saw them in any movie, so it was something fresh, new and hot :)), scenery was beautiful but the cheap, unfinished plot is just killing it. I simply had to comment this movie 'cause i am so pi*sed. Would you please do me a favor and kill Uwe Boll. But slowly and very painfully. And the last thing that is breaking my ball is the terrible music! When the music is on i had to shut it down 'cause its killing me. My ears are almost bleeding from it. Its like some amateur trying to play on violin. Disgusting. I don't know who did the music to this movie but kill him as well. Thank you ...

reviews.review_title: Terrible, absolutely Terrible
reviews.content: The thing about this movie is that I didn't know it was an Uwe Boll movie, but had the feeling that it was while watching it because it was that bad. After 30 minutes I turned it off and checked IMDb - and for sure, it was directed by Uwe Boll.The first 5 minutes were standard introductory fanfare, but then it all went downhill from there. The second you see Burt Reynolds hanging out as a king with Matthew Lillard, who's doing the finest Shakespeare impression you can expect from Matthew Lillard, you know the rest of the movie isn't going to get any better. Certain parts of the movie were so bad - the synthesizer-esquire musical score, low-budget "orc" costumes - that I couldn't tell if it was done on purpose for a comedy factor.There was no formative plot other than there's a crazy guy controlling these "orc" creatures who are killing everyone and Jason Statham must save his family. There may have been more, but I couldn't sit through the rest of it.How so many talented actors signed onto this movie is beyond me. The fact that the movie went on for another 2 hours just saddens me.

reviews.review_title: I enjoyed watching "In the name of the king"!!!
reviews.content: Despite all the bad critique "In the name of the king" received, I decided to rent it because I love the "adventure/action/fantasy" genre. I actually enjoyed watching it. Good acting! Loved Jason Statham in the lead role. He plays a farmer who tries to rescue his wife who was kidnapped by monsters who are controlled by a sorcerer. As always in fantasy movies it is "good versus evil", with a love story, magic, fighting scenes, and beautiful scenery included. All the leading roles are played by well known actors like Burt Reynolds, John Rhys-Davies, Claire Forlani and LeeLee Sobieski. Brian J White was drop dead gorgeous as commander Tarish. The only thing i didn't like about the movie was the music. It's OK to use "dramatic violin music" to set the mood in some scenes, but there was basically violin music throughout the whole film . If you enjoy the fantasy genre - then don't pay attention to the negative comments people give about Uwes work- go and rent it! It is worth the money!

reviews.review_title: Laughable! How did they get these stars to sign on for this?!
reviews.content: Saw this movie on Netflix...wish I hadn't. I figured "How bad could it be?" I mean, Jason Statham, right? OK, so he's portraying a farmer / warrior type guy back in the middle ages...but still. I've seen him in enough movies to know what to expect from him. And basically, he played the same character he always plays - only this time in a different time period.Aside from Statham's performance (which wasn't great), this movie was terrible! The main characters were all laughable! As soon as I saw Ray Liotta's character, I knew things were gonna be bad. By the time Burt Reynolds appears, I'd had enough.Don't waste your time.

reviews.review_title: Much better than Lord of the Rings
reviews.content: This movie would have been a shoo-in for a 10 out of 10, but the vine-women knocked it down to a 9. First off, the cast was much higher caliber than LOTR's; John Rhys-Davies, Ray Liotta, Painkiller Jane, Burt Reynolds, Ron Perlman, Jason Statham, and the chick from Mallrats. I personally will take King Farmer over King Aragorn any day of the week, and John Rhys-Davies makes a better Gandalf than Magneto ever did. Only the most un-American terrorist-lover would set a movie in New Zealand when we have the beautiful Pacific Northwest right in our backyard. One highlight was Jason Statham's beautiful escape from being hung by twirling around while hanging from the noose and killing the guy and cutting the rope with one swing of the bad guy's sword (though the ladies in the audience will undoubtedly argue he never really escaped from being hung). This movie also puts books firmly back in their rightful place as the weapons of villains, which was a move that was long coming. I can only wait and hope that the next two movies are picked up to top off the trilogy.

reviews.review_title: This movie is a crime against humanity.
reviews.content: I don't even know how Uwe Boll continues to get funding, much less how he gets actors like Jason Statham for projects like this. This is the worst film I've ever had the displeasure of sitting through.Some films are bad. Other films are so bad that they're good again. This is beyond that level of terrible into a whole new category worse than the absolute worst of Syfy original movies. Spare your eyes and watch something else. Remember the show Mystery Science Theater 3000, where two robot puppets and a campy actor made fun of terrible old science fiction movies? Go watch one of the movies they made fun of in that show, because it would be more moving and entertaining.

reviews.review_title: Good cast but...
reviews.content: Jason Statham just doesn't fit in movies like this one...

reviews.review_title: Cinematic Perfection
reviews.content: I saw this movie when it came out in theaters with my husband, brothers, and mom. The theater was absolutely silent, except for us. This movie made us laugh so hard. It is ridiculous and if you decide to watch this, do it with a sense of humor. It's bad but hilariously so. You'll get hippie tree strippers, scenes taken from Lord of the Rings, Orcs that light each other on fire and then launch them during battles. Get some popcorn, sit back and stop taking things too seriously.

reviews.review_title: somewhat entertaining
reviews.content: I don't get it why people hate Uwe Boll movies so much, ever since "Tunnel Rats" I think he's capable of making good ones. When people like flicks like "Braveheart" then they like this one, too. Or so I thought. To me there isn't much difference. This is not some low budget movie as you maybe would except it from Uwe Boll. Sometimes there are good actors involved but their acting is really poor in that particular movie but that's not the case here, either. Moreover you might think that this kind of story is too much of a predictable one but I don't think that applies here. There are well made and entertaining battles and great actors which makes this movie worthwhile watching if you're into this kind of stuff.

reviews.review_title: This movie was totally awesome!
reviews.content: I don't understand all the bad reviews on this movie. I thought it was a great epic! I loved everything about it! I love Jason Statham! I did not watch this movie with the intent to compare it to any other movie of its type, which would be unfair. I did not see the Lord of the Rings movies, which I'm sure were totally awesome but, then, why wouldn't they be, all things considered. This movie had everything I was looking for in this type of movie: great movie stars, action, romance, a little humor, beautiful cinematography, wizardry, and a happy ending! If you are looking to be entertained, and not compare it to other movies of this type, you won't be disappointed!

reviews.review_title: My eyes (and ears) are bleeding
reviews.content: What can I say. This movie had it all. Writing, acting, editing...the worst I've ever seen. I mean how much money did they have to pay these people to act to very, very badly. Ray Liotta, a great actor (i.e. Narc) why was he in this. Also why did they have a bunch of American actors trying to speak with horrific English accents? Couldn't they have found some underemployed British actors and at least had the accent correct? Who is Uwe Boll and why is he being allowed within 100 ft of a camera? IMDb states that this review must be a least 10-line long. This movie doesn't deserve a 10-line review, it's just that bad. I wonder if can type retching noises for the rest of the review?

reviews.review_title: This movie filled the objective of providing entertainment
reviews.content: Much of what comes out of Hollywood these days is epic nonsense and this movie has also inherited from that trait however I was amazed at the number of user comments that horrifically bashed this film like a class of kids and wannabe critics. I agree there are many flaws that someone on a mission to criticize could sink their teeth into so if it is your intent to go to this movie for that purpose then I ask on behalf of the audience to keep your comments to yourself. It is apparent that the actors and crew on this film really did work hard and try to deliver a product of entertainment. The film was fine for TV but I would have expected more for one in the theater. The only character that was really bad was Duke Fallow who was extremely annoying but didn't ruin the whole film. I agree that it is not a great film but no where near as bad as many commenters have depicted it to be although I suspect it would have been that bad if not for the great cast. Overall I was entertained and if you're not a critic wannabe then go ahead and see it.

reviews.review_title: Great, very classic movie from Uwe
reviews.content: Saw this yesterday when Uwe was also in the cinema. I must admit that I had my reservations on this movie, concerning Uwes lack of success in the past. But this one blew me away. Great performance from all actors with great plot and great lines. Some even funny scenes, of which I hoped there would be more. After all it is a sincere movie with deep plots- classic plots like good versus evil, man- wife, father-son relationship, father-daughter relationship, David versus Goliath etc. With so many great actors it must have been awful to cut each one down to 2 hours of play time. What really shines is the camera, not a strength of Uwe in the past. A lot of Close Ups that put maximum attention on the stars ability to act. This was reminiscent to how films were made in the first half of the last century- more Ben Hur than LOTR to sum it up. Also a plus Battlefield scenes that look much more realistic than most battle scenes in LOTR. Full Force Jason Statham fights like never seen before. CGI was always great and some scenes were totally new. Uwe answered some questions even referring to a second installment if this movie does well with the box office results. Really liked his down to earth approach, he is a real film maniac who cares a lot about his audience. Wonder if Tarantino shows so much affection towards his clients...

reviews.review_title: You know... for kids...
reviews.content: This movie is not that bad if you consider there's quite a few well known faces in it and the movie is a fairy-tale. Granted, I had to repeat the latter to myself otherwise I wouldn't be able to survive it, but then again, at least there were no kid heroes who fight adults. The movie is not exceptional in anything, but its not also exceptionally bad in any part. It's pretty straightforward, bad guys are bad, good guys are good, there's love in it, there's magic in it, there are wars with ugly ogres in it (or whatever they are), what else you want from a fairytale for kids ? I would recommend it when you wanna keep your youngsters occupied for two hours and they're under 13.

reviews.review_title: ouch
reviews.content: I'm sorry, but when I watch this movie it seems like children put it together. I have no problem with the over-all plot, just everything else. The costumes were bad, the script was bad and the directing was absolutely terrible. Not to mention the stupid camera tricks. Ray Liotta to me just seemed completely ridiculous. Who's fault that is I can't say, but I just know it was bad. The only person I feel sorry for is Jason Statham (well and a little for Burt Reynolds. Contrary to popular belief I think he could play a good king). He made the best out of a bad movie. He's a great actor and I hope one day he gets his due. I'm a sucker for the fantasy type stuff, but this was just plain bad. The director, costume designer and probably the producer('s) should simply be ashamed of themselves. I've seen better directing in porn.

reviews.review_title: Give him a break.
reviews.content: I'm not a Uwe Boll fan. I'm not a Uwe Boll hater. I take each of his movies as it comes, and I hope, more for the sake of the franchise than for him, that he finally finds his calling in film.This was an average fantasy film that is worth the matinée if you're a fan of the franchise or any of the actors (Hail Stathem). Otherwise, wait for a price drop The acting, even from the big names is a bit bland, and the story has nothing new or surprising.However, for Mr. Boll, average is quite good. He's getting there, he may peak now, or he may actually get somewhere with his movies.
