But don't throw this one out just because it has his name on it.Essentially, this is what I thought of the movie itself: it was entertaining. And isn't entertainment the point of seeing a movie in the first place? It was full of clichés, such as the acceptance of a new king from out of nowhere with no question, but this (and others) is a general problem in the genre, not just this movie. As I said before,the acting isn't top-notch,even if the cast is. The special effects are, however, quite nice. Lastly, the story, although nothing new, and rather predictable, isn't bad, and it's kind of funny to see nearly all of the characters butt heads the entire time, even allies.

reviews.review_title: Perfect example of a bad movie
reviews.content: I actually bought this movie recently because I just had to own this, I remember seeming this in theaters and just being amazing at how awkward and just how everything was not working. I think this film should be studied by film students because it's the only film I know that's a perfectly example of bad everything. Some movies have a bad story, others bad acting, but this is bad cinematography, bad story, bad lines, bad delivery of the lines, bad special effects, bad editing, bad costumes, bad literally everything. It's amazing. You know how Lord of the Rings makes Fantasy cool, this makes it nerdy again, in the worst way.

reviews.review_title: My "In The Name Of The King" Story
reviews.content: OK so it is a Wednesday, after a long day at work I go over to my parents for dinner and whatnot. After the meal my Dad asks if I want to watch this movie he rented that has Jason Statham in it (he is a huge fan ever since Lock, Stock). I say sure and he pops the DVD in. At first I was thinking well maybe the dialogue is supposed to be stilted and the dramatic raid on the town and I think, hmmm. About thirty minutes into the movie I just roll over on the couch and try to catch a nap. The movie kept playing and I couldn't fall asleep. After about fifteen minutes I think "god, this movie is awful, and I like awful movies!" Jokingly I say to my Dad, "I bet this is a Uwe Boll movie", he pays no attention and I look at the DVD cover and BAM! UWE FRAKING BOLL!!! I have never seen one of his films, but I did read the article in Wired a few years ago when he boxed some bloggers and the like. I couldn't believe it. He's is a director who's work I had never seen, rather avoided and I call it just from the sheer crap value of the picture. I am really sorry for the cast, I am betting the job for a paycheck...

reviews.review_title: Drop down and give me 120 minutes of your Life!!!
reviews.content: Imagine Xena Warriors costumes with Power Rangers Action in a Lord of the Rings rip off. Get ready to feel your gag reflex as you open your mouth to gape at this unholy siege on Hollywoods already low standards. See the amazing 16th century karate expert from England kick his way through men dressed in $5 costumes from Party City. See the famous actors bow down to serve a arch enemy of good taste. An enemy so vile he has been given the enough money to pay the likes of Ray Liota, Jason Stratham, Burt Reynolds and Ron Perlman. Uwe you are a true monster that must be stopped. Oh. Spoiler alert. This movie should come with a warning. May cause nausea.

reviews.review_title: A so-so movie.
reviews.content: I'm also a huge fan of fantasy/medieval-type movies however this one seemed to leech off all original work from Excalibur"http://imdb.com/title/tt0082348/" To the Lord of the Rings"http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0120737/" To include the primary combat scenes between the two major factions in the movie. However, the selected cast was well done and all of the actors and actresses played the parts very well.However. One thing that completely caught my eye was the ending music tracks during the closing credits. Blind Guardian and Hammerfall. Two of my favourite metal bands whom I needed to order on import to receive here in the states. I applaud whomever selected those particular tracks.

reviews.review_title: Looks good, impressive (but terrible) casting, Uwe is getting better
reviews.content: (In)famous for his game-to-movie adaptations, Uwe Boll hasn't earned respect from games all over the world. ITNOTK is a bit better than previous movies (Bloodrayne, Alone in the Dark etc) but definitely not great.Uwe is a strange dude. Despite the fact that I think he's a straight forward guy and I like his attitude ('I like what I do and earn my living so blow me'), he misses some important things to be taken more seriously:I just don't get it. How does Uwe Bolls keep getting these actors in his movies. While Christian Slater, Ben Kingsley and Michael Madsen have featured in his previous movies, ITNOTK has the following cast:Jason Statham as the London bloke trapped in a fantasy world, Burt Reynolds as the US Sean Connery clone as in The First Knight, Ron 'Hellboy' Perlman... well, doing his cool Ron Perlman thing, Ray Liotta in a ... Ray-Las-Vegas-Liotta-magician kinda role, with corresponding haircut, Matt 'Shaggy' Lillard as the kings retarded nephew, and hottie Claire Forlani as the MILFSo that's the lineup... impressive huh? So what about the movie?Well, the monsters were a bit crappy, the backgrounds and environments looked pretty good, 3d effects were decent, but nothing we haven't seen before. Too bad you can't say the same about the screenplay... what a mess.The story is very choppy, too many scenes in the movie were completely useless. Over-dramatic acting with the wrong actors make it very unbalanced and unbelievable. The correct timing could have make this movie a lot better.The action scenes are terrible: it's clear that every scene is built up of 40 shots pasted together. It's like they're not even trying to fit the shots seamlessly. off course Jason Statham and Ron Perlman can kick some serious ass, but the mix of martial arts and swordplay make it too modern.The thing that bugged me the most were the mix of American English and UK English and ... the Ninjas.Did you just say Ninjas? Yes, Ninjas my friend... What has Uwe been smoking when he thought of that?All together, the movie was fun to watch but could have been a lot better. My wife didn't complain about the movie so I guess this one was about the same level as The Bold and the Beautiful or As the World Turns ;)

reviews.review_title: Loved this movie!!!
reviews.content: Come on people. This movie was very funny. So many good actors too. I laughed so hard at times I was crying. The wardrobe alone was hysterical. The writing couldn't have been funnier. Like Ray Liotta's rs ...weally, (did you notice his similarity to Elvis?)How bout when the King, Reynolds, was near death from poison and the Magi gives him an antidote, such an intense moment, and what does he ask? How does it taste? Now that was funny. I am a big fan of Jason Statham and can drool over him in any movie but besides him ,I have to say I was entertained by this movie in a seriously comedic way. I will definitely buy the DVD.

reviews.review_title: One of the Worst!
reviews.content: This may be the worst movie I've seen in several years, so I felt obligated to join in and inform people not to waste ANY time on it. I don't remember why my buddy and I decided to watch this in the first place. I'll admit the stupidity of it all actually made us laugh pretty hard a few times, but that's the only redeeming aspect you can find to this movie. After this one, I've officially concluded that Jason Statham just accepts any movie script you throw at him, cause he should have seen how bad this would be from the start. Uwe Boll is obviously well known for directing some of the worst movies around, which had I known that in the first case I would never have watched it. All the acting in the movie is HORRIBLE, which is surprising since some of the actors have actually been in tons of other movies and done a decent job. Ray Liota's character is dumb. Jason Statham's character name being 'Farmer', doesn't help anything since his acting is very sub par in this as well. Matthew Lillard become my least favorite actor for at least a year after his devastating performance in this movie as Duke Fallow. To go along with the bad acting, this movie couldn't have possibly took much to make since the bad guys known as the "Grug" I believe look like the initial Power Rangers villains from the early nineties. All in all this is an outrageously bad movie that I should not have the misfortune to see for sale on store shelves. Enjoy!

reviews.review_title: Horrible!
reviews.content: Oh the horror! Horrible, laughable acting from all parties. Fight scenes were hideous. Special effects juvenile. Fifteen minutes of this were more than enough of this disaster!

reviews.review_title: How does Uwe Boll do it?
reviews.content: How does Uwe Boll do it? I mean, how does he convince well know actors with real stage and screen credits to act in one of his god-awful films? Blackmail? Coercion? Pictures of their loved ones tied to chairs and being forced to watch BloodRayne over and over again? Ron Perlman's and John Rys-Davies' talents are sadly wasted here. Never mind the fact that Ray Liotta is better than this! And certainly Burt Reynolds (whom you youngsters may not know was an Oscar nominee in his day) is better than this! And talented actors they all are, so this is definitely not their fault. With good material and good direction these actors can handle anything.Which brings us back to the point I'm trying to make. The direction is not just wooden, it's lame - and I'm guessing Boll's "vision" for the film was phoned in - long distance - even during the final edit. Though I can't see how even a great editor could have saved this mess from becoming schlock. He just wouldn't have any competently directed scenes on film to work with!Maybe Uwe Boll's films make money in non-English speaking countries where no one can tell that the dialog is trite and the acting is stilted. No, not stilted, smothered - by the kind of mis-direction that wouldn't be acceptable in an undergraduate film class. But that's still no excuse. So please, somebody, anybody, get the dirt on Mr. Boll so we can find out how he does it -- and stop him before he does it again!

reviews.review_title: Really Well
reviews.content: all u are a bunch of hater,,this movie was really cool and awesome..great film but if u didn't like it thats ur fault..no taste...i enjoyed the film:),,jason was the best in the film...even though some of you guys make some points the movie was not a waste of time ..it was cool and fun... even though the comedy parts that u guys said were kinda true it was a 9 in my book out of ten..great actors and a great film..if you don't like films like in the name of the King then this was not for you so don't bother even writing about it..i did like it and it was worth a whole Sunday spent even took some family members to see it and they liked it too...in my book its really well

reviews.review_title: great actors, good film!!
reviews.content: This film should not be compared to LOTR!! it is really good but not in the same league. Do not be put of with the other comments, Jason Statham plays a completely different role to what he is used to and carries it off really well!! I loved the way that Jason Statham brought he own skills to the fighting scenes which include kick boxing and Brazilian jujitsu, you don't expect to see this in that type of film!! There are a lot of well know actors in this film and they all contribute in their own unique well, Matthew Lillard bring some comedy to the film as well as the presence of Burt Renynolds as the mighty king!! Iam not a great fan of this type of film but to sit through 2ish hours it must be good!! Good story line, good fight scenes and good ending! What more could you want!!! Not the best but well worth a look!!!

reviews.review_title: plagued
reviews.content: This movie has some pretty good visuals, and Owe does a decent job of directing the script....but to me thats the problem. The script is weak; and besides Jason Statham and Ron Pearlman, the acting is horrible. Not just a few glitches horrible, I'm talking about Ben Affleck horrible. Over and over again I felt like I was watching a fantasy nightmare. Burt Reynolds as the King??? Matt Lilliard as a Prince??? Ray Liotta as a poor man's Sauron? To think that a movie studio would pony up the money to finance such garbage is unbelievable; maybe I'll have a chance to be a screen writer if this is what Hollywood has to succumb to. OK, I got it...."Lethal Weapon 5," starring Clay Aiken.

reviews.review_title: How do you make such a bad movie?
reviews.content: I, like other reviewers, expected this to be a bad movie and as such was braced for a subpar film. But I figured with Jason Statham, Leelee Sobieski, Ray Liota, Ron Perlman, Clair Forlani and Jonn Rhys-Davies that there would have to be some redeeming qualities. There were not.This sinkhole of a movie was like 5% Lord of the Rings and 95% Power Rangers. The fights were ridiculous and the bad guys were in rubber suits. I just do not know how this movie actually made it to the screen. You think at some point someone would have screened it and realized that this much suck in the same movie just needs to be put out of its misery. This is the first review I have written on IMDb and am only writing it in the hopes that you can avoid this movie.

reviews.review_title: My type of movie
reviews.content: I liked it, not the type of film that's going to win a lot of Oscars but I found it very watchable. The other reviews that are giving it low marks are a little bit unfair maybe, basically if you like Rambo and rocky you'll like this and if you're more into titanic (I've not seen titanic) or Brigit Jones diary (not seen that either) then I'd say you'll turn this off after 5 minutes (as I did with both titanic and bjd). Ray Liotta gives the performance of his career which by itself is worth the rental money but there's more to the film than just that, as long as you don't take thing too seriuosly and you like action films with a limited story then this film is great, I wouldn't change a thing about it, apart from maybe on the DVD release they could've condensed all the Ray Liotta bits into one segment and have it as an option to just watch that, "you've won nothing but time".

reviews.review_title: Definitely not as bad as everyone here says
reviews.content: This film wasn't nearly as bad as everyone made it out to be. Yes, its not some masterpiece, and as others have commented, not in keeping with the traditional fantasy genre, so what? It's a freaking movie.The ninja complaints... That's just ridiculous, who cares if they put some ninjas in the film. They aren't some integral part of the movie, they just had diverse troops, how cool.The story line isn't bad at all, its very predictable, as most films are, but small things happen throughout the movie that keep your attention and should amuse someone who is looking for an easy to watch film. Someone recommended this for people with children 8-13, I don't know what you let your kids watch, I am 25 and have no kids of my own, but I don't think this film is appropriate for anyone under 13. There is a great deal of violence, some of it graphic in nature if not necessarily explicit (gory).I would recommend this film to someone who wants to see a cool story, some nice concepts, and half decent acting.

reviews.review_title: Miserable
reviews.content: I can't believe I was excited and purchased this title without first seeing who directed it. Same thing I did with Bloodrayne. I was about a 1/4 the way through when I thought wth is this? The special effects were awful, the acting was awful. With great actors no less! Only Uwe Boll could make this travesty. Horrible. I have to put ten lines of how much this sucked stir-fried rear end. I forced myself to watch the whole thing just to say I got something form my 20 bucks. So glad I did not go to the theater and watch this travesty. Should have been able to tell when it only lasted a week at the theatre. I think I saw a comment from someone who stated that this is better than LOTR! I would really like to meet this person. Die gustibus non est dispuntandum!

reviews.review_title: WOW! and not in a good way
reviews.content: I am watching this movie right now and I have to say I am not impressed. I have already figured out the plot and am not even paying attention any more. You would think with great, fun actors like Jason Statham, Leelee Sobieski, John Rhys-Davies, Ron Perlman and Matthew Lillard it would be a great fun movie. I looked up some info and this crap actually won a few awards! it won a Leo Award for Best Costume Design in a Feature Length Drama and Best Production Design in a Feature Length Drama. Which is not bad but there had to have been something better nominated! And why oh why was it nominated for Best Picture Editing in a Feature Length Drama. This is the worst edited movie ever! It made no sense! Go figure the Leo Awards are Canadian. In Germany it one an award for sound. Maybe its just the DVD I am watching but the music is so loud I came barley hear the dialoge Actually that may be may be a blessing! There is too much action and not enough story. The scenes that advance the storyline are so few and far between and chopped up I forget what's going on. The only reason I give it 2 stars is for the performances of Rhys-Davies, Perlman, Lillard and Sobieski. I find now that I enjoy watching them in anything and I mean anything. I feel as is I am watching a side story while the actaul plot is going on some where else.

reviews.review_title: Not even close to the story of the game. First film with Statham I didn't like...
reviews.content: With my missus we decided to buy this movie on bluray for 3 reasons: 1. We were playing the game. I finished both parts with extension packs and the Dugeon Siege is one of the best games I have ever played with great story, lots of action and great gfx. So we thought, game's great so maybe the film won't be bad... 2. We both love films with Jason Statham, always loaded with action. So why would this one be bad? 3. The price was great and we could get it for a tenner, which seemed to be great value. After watching the film, we said the same thing: 5th category cinematography. It didn't even resemble the original story of the game, apart from a couple of names. Krugs looked somewhat cheap... I can only say, if you don't have anything to do and can get it for free from a friend to watch, go on. You could always spend that time in a worse way (drinking, taking drugs etc.) If you are to pay for it, don't bother.

reviews.review_title: A waste of a good evening
reviews.content: This movie was recently on Dutch television and got some pretty high recommendations because of the cast, but sadly the cast performs very poorly in this particular movie. Although the actors are trying to make the best of it, the script and the overall story is terrible. It's incoherent, poorly played and absolutely unconvincing.What bothered me especially, was the score of the movie. The music was sometimes way over the top for what happened on screen and it also was a complete LOTR rip-off at times (When farmer is first introduced for example).Dialogs are poorly acted and battles tend to be repetitive and the scenes are way too long.The only reason why I don't mark it a 1 vote is that the visual effects are pretty nice at times but it doesn't make up for this garbage.A waste of my evening.

reviews.review_title: Was hoping for at least 5 minutes of entertainment. Found 10 seconds..
reviews.content: I go into most movies with no preconceived notions about the actors, the director or the plot. This is hard to do for a movie like Inception or Toy Story 3, but for In the Name of the King, the only things I knew were that Jason Statham was in the "lead" role, and there were going to be some swords involved. I like swords. And I have liked just about every movie I've seen with Statham (except Ghosts of Mars, but I'll forgive you, Jason). Maybe this will be okay...Statham is more of just an exhibit in the film instead of an integral part. He's like "the bearded lady" at a carnival...just something that sells tickets. He has few scenes, fewer lines and generally spends most of his time on screen performing glorified tumbling. Sadface. In a hilarious nod to the video game on which the movie is based, Statham's character is called just 'Farmer'.The movie isn't short on high caliber actors, though. Burt Reynolds is here, although he plays his king character as if he can't wait for his inevitable death scene so he can hit up the local bar. Claire Forlani, with her hypnotic eyes, stops by for a few minutes to portray a beleaguered mother. Ray Liotta is horribly misused as an egotistical wizard of sorts. And a haggard Matthew Lillard is annoying as usual. Even John Rhys-Davies seems devoid of life.But wait! There are bright spots! Leelee Sobieski is at least passable as misguided princess Muriella. And Ron Perlman steals any scene in which he has a part. He has somehow crafted a way to be believable(!) So many of the other actors seem to be here only for the paycheck. A-ha! There is a reason these actors don't seem invested. "Directed By: Uwe Boll" If I continued to fail at my career the way Boll has at his, I would be driven to the outskirts of town, shot in the back of the head and left for the vultures to pick me clean. Why did so many quality actors take these roles? A quick run-down of Boll's accomplishments in this film:*made every fight scene incredibly tedious & boring *dialogue written for/by third graders *made me hate John Rhys-Davies for about two hours (you bastard!) *special effects on par with the television show Charmed *costumes flat-out laughable *I also swear I saw Forlani yawn at one point!So we'll forgive the actors here. We've all heard a good craftsmen never blames his tools, but that's when the tools he is given aren't rusted & broken. DO NOT see this movie if you are expecting anything remotely original. DO NOT see this movie if you are expecting to see a quality Statham action flick. DO NOT see this movie if you think it might be interesting to see Burt Reynolds in the role of a medieval-ly king. Just don't see it period.

reviews.review_title: What the..?
reviews.content:
For the love of god, do NOT even waste time pressing play on this sorry piece of 'entertainment'.
A bad cross between Lord of the Orcs and Maid Marian and her Merry Women. No wonder Matthew Lillards' career is in the balance.I can't even be bothered to finish this revi...

reviews.review_title: Not a good film, but a lot of fun.
reviews.content: The entire point of watching this movie for me was "Jason Statham fighting orcs". and that's exactly what I got.This is not an epic gripping fantasy. This is a blatant kinda-like-lord-of-the-rings excuse for Jason Statham to fight orcs. I would have given it more stars if it didn't seem like at times it tried to kind-of-act-like it took itself seriously. And it needed more fighting and less talking.the overused fantasy plot twists and the goofy fight scenes make this movie great as long as you DON'T EXPECT ANYTHING MORE. This is a camp fantasy flick with a hilarious cast. Which actually impresses me because I think it's the first time I've really ever seen a campy fantasy movie that wasn't trying not to be a campy fantasy movie.If you don't like the idea of jason statham knocking out 5 orcs by throwing a boomerang, tree climbing archer ninjas, cirque de sole killing people, and six foot boulders being pushed like they weigh 50 lbs. You won't like this movie. The big fight scenes are the best part of this movie, they are absolutely filled with tons of "wtf did that really just happen?" "yeah they totally just did that" moments, that make it so much fun to watch.As for me, I loved it and I'm putting it in the category of "a good time" as far as movies go. My only complaint is that the ending lacked a really awesome one-liner.

reviews.review_title: A waste of 120mins of my life!
reviews.content: Well I guess I should have looked up this director (Uwe Boll) for more information about his work. This movie was god awful. Being a fan of Jason Statham, I was quite compelled to buy this movie. But it was just a waste of money. This movie has just been a waste of money and on actors such as Statham, its going to look very bad on their portfolio.This movie has no character development whatsoever and there has been too much information squeezed into 127 minutes. And who ever heard of naming a farmer "FARMER".Overall in my opinion this is a very bad movie.I would not recommend this movie to anyone to watch even as a last resort.

reviews.review_title: My son worked as an extra on the film and that is not enough to make me want to watch it
reviews.content: Awful is the only word for the film. My son was an extra so I had to be on set while he was in the film. What I saw of the production that day did not inspire confidence the film would be at all decent. There was little no consideration being given to how the scenes should work or have continuity between takesWhen we finally watched it when was screened here in Victoria and it was worse than I could have imagined. In some of the scenes I could see the problems with the continuity caused by no attention to any detail.The plot is more or less missing for the movie which leaves you ask Why? most of the time.Burt Reynolds as the king is so bad as to almost be funny.The only actors that brought anything to the film were Jason Statham and Ron Perlman

reviews.review_title: Don't do it to yourself. I just lost 2 hours i ain't never getting back
reviews.content: Well, if you were to read the cast it is a bit like a whose who of modern cinema. Put them all together with a shoddy director, terrible dialogue, terrible effects (Think i saw a guy wearing a straw hat in the fight halfway through) and a length of nearly 2hrs ten and you have what has to be one of the worst movies i have seen this year if not ever! I don't know what the budget is but i dare say it was spent on the cast and not the movie. I think you get my point so i will stop before i write something improper.Now for some bullet points:Bad Points: ( Here i Go!)1) Director and direction. 2) Writer and Script adaptor for screen. 3) Costume - I mean, these bad soldier guys? Come on... 4) The CAST! I mean, did the not read the script and see what drivel they were getting themselves in for. 5) The Length of the movie. Schindlers list, Forrest Gump. No problems for spinning a movie out there. This? You are kidding. Good Points:1) UmmmmmmmmmHope you like my review!

reviews.review_title: A Modern Masterpiece
reviews.content: When it comes to epic fantasy move over Lord Of The Rings here comes In The Name Of The King. Uwe Boll lets this film flow with beauty,grace and great storytelling. Jason Staham's acting as Farmer is academy award worthy also Uwe Boll's Direction is flawless. This film also is much to short i just wanted more. I know Uwe Boll has made crap like House Of The Dead and Alone In The Dark but this film is a flawless for 2 and a half hours. Another thing the cast is spectacular especially Jason Staham and Kristanna Loken who really should be in more films she is a wonderful actress. This film is probably the best film of the 21st century knocking of the previous best We Are Marshall. If you want to see a epic masterpiece see In The Name Of The King.

reviews.review_title: Amazing cast...like the epitome of the avengers!
reviews.content: Statham fan big time. Liotta! Is the crap! Then I had to get drunk af. Just to watch some of the worst acting...worst sword fighting...worst battles since Harry Potter ride his first broom...shockingly surprised at how bad the story line rides the bad action...only saving grace is my love of Stephen King....pretty sure I'm watching a bad recreation of the Watchtower..

reviews.review_title: You don't have to watch this movie
reviews.content:
First of all you should not watch this movie only and only to see Jason Statham because Jason Statham can't carry this movie on his back and the funny thing is That I watched this movie after Batman Dark Knight which is a movie that I recommend you watch .
Let's talk about this movie first of all it has some scenes that you can connect with the characters and you get emotional and there is Jason Statham who despite the movie was bad he gave his best self in this movie but anything else in this movie is just BAD and after watching this movie I laughed exactly like joker because I couldn't find any reason to put it more than 3 stars well the 3rd star is thanks to Statham .
I firmly believe that this movie DOES NOT WORTH YOUR TIME thanks for reading.

reviews.review_title: An Honest Review
reviews.content: I saw this film when looking on IMDb to see the films that Jason Statham had been in. I am a fan as i like to be entertained. A lot of his films are over the top action, but i find that very entertaining. He will never win an Oscar, but most of his films are great fun. I wondered why I had not seen this advertise at the cinema, but within the first 10 minutes it was completely obvious that this film skipped the cinema and went straight to DVD and didn't waste any time going to 'free view with your package' on love film.Where to start, this is clearly inspired by the Lord of The Rings films, which i loved. But the first problem with this film is the director Uwe Boll. I'm surprised this guy has been given the responsibility as director. This really is not his true talent. I feel sorry for anyone who was duped into being involved in the film thinking it would be an epic fantasy film that would end up a classic. The cast is good enough for an action film. Statham is Statham and it feels like you are watching The Transporter, but in the woods. He is convincing as a tough guy, but doesn't fit with this type of film. Burt Reynolds looked the part, but looked like he was filling a space in his schedule as he is so wooden and makes no effort. John Rhys-Davies is his usual over the top self. He almost provides some creditability, but almost becomes laughable.Rather than compare this film to LOTR's i think it would be best to compare it to Xena Warrior Princess. It has that cheap family feel to it especially when they add in the pointless pieces of comic relief.This film is a massive waste of time. I'm glad i watched it on my own on a weed night and didn't watch it with friends on a Saturday night as if it was my choice then no one would allow me to pick another film ever again. I would recommend that if you see this to rent/buy or watch online that you do not hesitate and just move to whatever is next.Bad directing, bad script, bad acting, bad special effects, but reasonable fight scenes, but it was very noticeable that they only had about 100 extras just doubling up. When they have the army lined up they are quick to move to another angle before they run out of people to fill the shot. The creatures are really poorly designed and are not scary or creepy what so ever.If you are a fan of Xena then you still may be disappointed in this 156 minute movie. Shocking film.

reviews.review_title: Nice try!
reviews.content: The only reason why I watched this movie is because my friend appeared briefly as an extra. Thankfully he made his appearance 20 minutes into it. After that I lost interest. I just want to know how they cast Leelee Sobieski? She must have been strapped for cash if she agreed to do this. Burt Reynolds added a touch of comic relief, and Ray Liotta should stick to "Wise Guy" roles. Who decided to dress him as an Elvis Presley impersonator. Anyways... I have seen worse movies. If you have a couple of hours to waste then give it a go, just watch it alone! By the way, my friend is the guy with a beard who is standing next to Jason Statham in the village when Burt Reynolds is looking for soldiers to join his army. Nice job Pete!

reviews.review_title: The poor man's version of "The Lord of the Rings"...
reviews.content: Awful. Not even Jason Statham could save this utter abomination set to celluloid. The fight scenes were not even fun one bit in the least, if anything, they were boring. The dialogue was also unbearably atrocious. The special effects were abysmal, too! I could not wait for it to be over with. I want 2 hours and 7 minutes of my life back. If you want a grand epic adventure film, watch Peter Jackson's live-action adaptation of J.R.R. Tolkien's "The Lord of the Rings" trilogy, but whatever you do, AVOID "In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale" like the plague. Put simply, this movie was a complete train wreck and like most of Uwe Boll's other films, it makes anything by Ed Wood look Oscar-worthy.

reviews.review_title: Great epic from Mr Boll
reviews.content: After reading comments in this column, I find it hard to believe they have seen the same movie as I have. Alright, Mr Boll have earlier made some lousy movies, but this has nothing to do with this movie. Give the man some credit, this time he has actually made a good movie. It is an epic action driven movie, the scenes are beautiful and even stunning at times, the script is well written, the camera work is quality work and the visuals are more than adequate. I even find the casting quite good, and to be honest I loved to see good old Burt Reynolds as King. In my opinion Ray Liotta is also perfect as the evil mage. A highly entertaining epic flick with a bunch competent actors and well directed, a movie I will enjoy watching again and again. If this is the new standard for future Uwe Boll movies, I look forward to his next movie. Thumbs up:)

reviews.review_title: Bad
reviews.content: What a waste of a movie. I like the facts the enemies are supposed to look like orcs from lotr but instead they look like cheap costumes. Cgi was bad writing was bad.I can't believe how bad the writing was in this movie to the point where even legendary actors can't carry it. I bet this movie even ruined some of these actors that played in it.Even if it's 2007 the cgi was horrible. It'd like boll tried to replicate lotr but with sub standard quality.I don't know if boll is the sole reason for this massive flop but looking at his other movies I think it is. This man can't write a movie nor should be allowed to do it again.

reviews.review_title: Why all the hate ?
reviews.content: I enjoyed this very much, I don't understand all the one stars I really don't. Jason provided action in a genre where we usually lose out. I am not sure what all you 1 star people were hoping for. Yes the characters could have been more developed. However that is difficult to do unless you are going to put it into an already known genre/realm (lotr) and spend a lot of money and over three films on it. Précis I enjoyed it, you haters need to chill out. As far as I am concerned anything that entertains me is a win, I find myself entertained. To let you know where I stand, Eragon (as a recent reviewer mentioned) was not entertaining, like sticking every good book I had read and putting it in a blender.

reviews.review_title: Awesome B Movie
reviews.content: Apparently I'm a stupid idiot who's getting paid money for writing this review... wait, no I'm not.Yes, the film was a little choppy. But where are the bad reviews on all of the highly acclaimed films that DO THE SAME THING? Very few movies are able to transition wonderfully on a consistent basis.I loved the actors they chose, I think given the lines they were working with that they all did a good job (some were over-the-top *cough*RayLiotta*cough*). Also - why does everyone keep mentioning the seaweed tidbit that the King told Farmer? Why is that so hilarious? Kings are expected (or at least they were at one point) to know about their kingdom. And knowing how you can wring more profit (in this case food) from your constituents was of grave importance to kings and their advisers (who made sure to tell them).I loved this movie, my husband loved this movie and we bought it as soon as we could. I must have seen a different movie than everyone else, because I see no LOTR or Matrix references. I was able to see this movie and enjoy it for what it was: a B movie, but a good movie none-the-less.

reviews.review_title: Compared to other Uwe Boll travesties...
reviews.content: this movie is a masterpiece. Don't get me wrong I think that Uwe Boll should be banned from making movies (maybe the UN could enforce this...) and be forbidden from writing scripts. While the script for this movie was mediocre its far better than anything Mr. Boll writes. I was glad to see that he just directed and didn't write it. The only thing that this movie has going for it is the fact that it has so many high end actors and a superb supporting cast. I do realize that this movie has some bad acting but even that has its merits (it makes the excellent performance of John Rhys-Davis seem so much cooler).When you compare this film to the other "films" done by Uwe Boll this movie is Lawrence of Arabia in comparison (not that this movie is that good, his other films are THAT BAD). However like Mr. Bolls other movies, you watch this film and can't stop watching even though you hate yourself for watching it. Its the kind of film that you are too embarrassed to tell your friends that you watched it.

reviews.review_title: review by tpaladino
reviews.content: obviously never going to be as good as LOTR (any of the 3) but i would take this persons review more seriously if they could spell the directors name correctly, especially seeing as they could get it from the top of the page.it's a Jason Statham film without a car let alone a car chase maybe there will just be a lot of horse power.some good names (Ray Liotta and Burt Reynolds) that you can never go wrong with, however i haven't actually watched it so i could be wrong.I only posted this cos tpaladino's comment annoyed me!!San Dimas College Football Rules

reviews.review_title: Not Recommended.
reviews.content: Browsing my netflix this film caught my eye, I enjoy a good fantasy film and it has some big names like Jason Statham. So I went in to this film hopeful. Right off the bat the music ruins the whole thing. It's desperately trying to create a mood but only ends up being jarring and off putting. The writing is abysmal. Some of the lines are cringe worthy. The costumes are hit and miss - some of the krug are good, but some, are terrible. The camera angles and special effects look rushed in some scenes (not sure what was happening there). I'm not completely sure how they convinced so many actors to star in this, or how they got the money to make it. I don't wish to blame any particular person for it, but someone somewhere had to have known how horribly wrong this was going.Overall, I'd give it a miss. Unless you're playing drinking games. Might be good then.

reviews.review_title: the perfect movie
reviews.content: A fast paced explosion of everything thats good about films. hope the krangs were okay after.

reviews.review_title: What's the beef?
reviews.content: I saw this on TV tonight and don't feel it was a waste of time. Reading the reviews on here afterward was a waste. If a movie holds your attention it has achieved something. This Uwe Boll seems to take a pounding but this was no cheap flick. People need to see a film as they did when they were kids; to be entertained. We even enjoyed the films that we made fun of while watching. My son of 15 would have enjoyed this but since he wasn't here I watched it for him. Burt Reynolds: Glad to see him working. The other name actors seemed to be enjoying themselves. Some movies you can watch more than once. I'm not saying this is one of them.

reviews.review_title: meh
reviews.content: I overall enjoyed the story of Farmer(Jason Statham). Ray Liotta and Matthew Lillard were almost painstaking to watch, because of their terrible overacting. It was like they were trying to make this movie a comedy. If they would have made Duke Fallow as an arrogant, greedy, and selfish duke instead of an unfunny drunk it might have been better. and I was confused with Leelee Sobieski's role, like who was she and what did she have to do with anything. and what was with the Krugs? the costumes were horrible. You could tell the kings army was fighting people in costumes. I also thought it was weird how the krugs on horses would point their arms like they were directing traffic in slow motion. Movie could have used more magic and made Leelee's role more exciting. Like I said earlier, I did like Farmer.

reviews.review_title: Some things to appreciate
reviews.content: Well this movie isn't that horrible as everyone says, but is far away to be a great movie. The work of Uwe is horrible, the worst i've seen in years, Burt Reynolds usually does great movies, and the same can be said about Claire Forlani, but because of the direction he looks dumb, and she makes some screams that sounds like if she was having an orgasm when she,in fact, was being hurt. There are some(SOME)good camera moments and the costumes are great too. Maybe the make-up job is bad in some parts of the movie.The special effects are OK, maybe the two final fights, between the two magi and between Gallian(another weak point) and the Farmer, are the two best examples of this. Another thing to note, and this is a matter of personal taste, is the battle "art", the elves(?) use the lianas like if they were in a circus, and the fight are very ninja-like, contrasting with the general environment of the movie.At the end is a movie with good actors and a good idea, but the Director messed up. If you love the genre, maybe you can enjoy somethings, but if not.... don't waste your time

reviews.review_title: Sad
reviews.content: So...I have been able to sit through some very bad movies. This is not the worst and it is entertaining in a mediocre way if you're hungry for a medieval fantasy flick. Sadly, the wonderful array of actors is wasted on this movie.It's fun to see people like Ron Perlman and John Rhys-Davies, but here they are mixed in with Burt Reynolds and Ray Liotta, both fine actors but not in this genre. Actually, nobody is fine in the movie. The characters are not well developed, especially the women of the movie. The dialog is just plain silly and the special effects do not flow smoothly. I wanted to root for Farmer but the book I was reading was more interesting. Still, the movie was watchable, if uneven.

reviews.review_title: How is it possible to make such bad movie with so much great actors?
reviews.content: Seriously how is it possible in 2007 (6 years after The Fellowship of the Ring) to make a movie this bad? And with so many good actors.It is like seeing a train wreck from the very begin, you can't take your eyes from it but you also know it will keeping to get even worst.Not the worst time wasted I ever did but probably comes very close. The only positive thing is that I have learned to never again see anything from this director.If you didn't see it please save yourself and skip it.

reviews.review_title: Why can't I give it a rating of 0?!?
reviews.content: If you have the desire to watch your best friends suffer in a most horrific and distasteful manner, but have been searching for the proper way to carry out this punishment, your search has finally ended. In what I can only describe as your local meth head's Return of the King I present to you Uwe Boll's Magnum Opus. Where do I begin in describing the beauty, the brilliance, nay the piece de resistance that is Uwe Boll's In the Name of the King: A Dungeon Siege Tale. Featuring mostly wooden performances, laughable dialogue, and shoddy production values, In the Name of the King fulfills all expectations of a Uwe Boll film. You will not be disappointed as you live the adventure through the eyes of Farmer, a lowly farmer who has the misfortune of living next door to Hellboy, I mean, Mugatu's fugly older brotherI mean Ron Perlman. Watch as Farmer (Jason Statham), attempts to avenge the murder of his child and try to save his beloved wife from the acting of Ray Liotta (I mean honestly, that is the real reason he is the villain in this movie). Experience the pain as Farmer must witness Uwe Boll blackmail Gimli and Burt Reynolds into being featured in this film (they really didn't want those nude pics leaked), much like Julie Andrews in The Princess Diaries 2. Prepare for a roller coaster of emotions as you try to contain disbelief from the get go, anger as you realize that you are still watching this film, and finally joy as you revel in the utter bliss signaling the credits. I give it two thumbs somewhere.

reviews.review_title: Confused but Happy

The scenery was good, story was good, plots were almost key on. Other than some inept acting by Matthew Lillard it was pretty good.I think they could have done much better with Liotta's character, first by casting someone else and second make him look less like a steam punk knock off and maybe more in genre.My other complaint was the Krugs. This must have been the part of the budget that got the least input. I wont even get started.

The ridiculous music and sound effects and cheesy acting make possibly decent story line and turns it to crap. Even the A list actors cant make a Uwe Boll film good.Honestly this story has so much potential to actually be a good movie, there's obviously a good funding for this particular film, the graphics have been pretty damn good. The stunts have been a feat and a half to watch. I particularly enjoyed the "amazon" women in the forest. It was good to see Leelee in acting again, even if it was in a Uwe Boll film. >.>

reviews.review_title: Bizarre
reviews.content: This has to be the most disappointing movie ever. Great cast but third rate directing, editing ab and production. Almost thought it was a spoof of a real movie. Unfortunately it just sucks.You keep watching waiting for it to get better and it just never does. The same amateur scenes just keep coming. You know from past performances that the cast (well most of them) can act. So how can every scene come off so (B) movie? Again bizarre is all I can say. Ray Liotta was so miss cast its almost comical if not so disappointing. He comes off like Ming in Flash Gordon.So please don't waste the time.

reviews.review_title: Hardcore fantasy fans only. I enjoyed watching Farmer with his 'my way or the highway' approach battle through the film. But many won't.
reviews.content: This is a film about an apparently simple farmer's fight for justice and revenge when a horde of Lord of the rings left over troll extras invade his land and kidnap/kill his family. So, having watched this film I went online out of curiosity to check out some facts. It became quickly apparent that the film's director- Uwe Boll- has a pretty bad reputation for making howlers based on video-games. I disagree with this reputation as I enjoyed In the name of the King- for all its hammyness, its lack of polish and bizarreness. Uwe is also only able to make his films thanks to some strange laws they have in Germany where if a film fails to make money investors don't stand to lose much.Turnips, turnips, turnips. It begins with Jason Stractham, the film's hero, in a field pulling turnips out of the ground with his young son. The situation feels surreal- and not just because it's a fantasy film. You have this butch guy talking in a gruff, and slightly overdone, London hardman accent whilst his 'son' talks with a strong American accent. I just thought 'weird' immediately. It also becomes quickly evident that they like their sayings and idioms wherever their field of turnips is as farmer (Jason's character name) seems to use every opportunity to get a few wise words in. Having trouble pulling up the big turnips son? That's because the 'good things in life don't come easy' etc, etc So poorly scripted at times.There is a general feeling of lack of cohesion between scenes at times, with some scenes even leaving you wondering why they were there. I felt the whole thing needed to be polished more as it feels rough around the edges.The whole story and even look of the film is so Lord of the rings like it is amazing how some of the big name actors could do it. The evil wizard with a very non- descript army of trolls working underground. Hmm.. Then there are the boring and characterless and just plain odd forest women who don't like to get involved in human affairs but, as you already know from the moment you see them, will eventually help the good guys by the end of the film Apart from that, I found the action scenes to be pretty good at times- even though at the beginning- it really reminded me of the power rangers when they fight faceless goons in a generic way. There are some decent set pieces and a huge battle later with the realm's king (Burt Reynolds) involved. The two magi (wizards) fight is well-done- and quite different to Gandalf and the evil wizard fight in the first lord of the rings apart from them being in a little room and controlling things with magic.I found the film diverting enough though. I enjoyed watching Farmer with his 'my way or the highway' approach battle through the film. And it is bad enough to somehow keep you interested. I would give it 6 out of ten as I like this type of film so much it is hard for me not to enjoy it. If you don't enjoy this type of magical heros and fantasy film then its 2 out 10.

reviews.review_title: A decent movie
reviews.content: I have read most of the reviews on this site after I watched the movie, and that only happened because I saw the name "Uwe Boll" at the end. I honestly did not know it was he that directed this, and all I can say - its a big surprise. This may be the best film that he has ever made. I saw "Postal", "Bloodrayne", awful, God awful movies that should not be allowed to exists, but this ? This is actually a good movie. The only thing that seemed out of the medieval picture were those ninja's ... man that was weird. It was weird to see Asian guys dressed in tight leather dual-wielding swords. That's it, other than that, the amazons with the vines make perfect sense, because its a land and a time of magic, where things like this can and should exist. Also Statham has his charisma as an action hero, the fight scenes were very entertaining, the camera works was good, and I personally enjoyed all of the cast except for Muriella. I don't know why, but in that movie this woman just rubs me the wrong way, no pun intended. In the end, I can safely say that I recommend this movie, watch it and form your own opinion, and please don't judge the low score. I'm not here to debate it, I'm just saying that its way off given the actual value of the film.

reviews.review_title: Not that bad, honestly, expected lot worse.
reviews.content: Uwe Boll is not the greatest director out there, enough said. But the movie, with all it's fantasy clichés, based on a game that is a shameless rip and as void from deep thoughts and meanings as the movie, really works. I've read some of the comments that this should not be compared to LOTR. May I ask why? Compared to LOTR this movie is jam packed with action and momentum, not the least a decent ending. Of course, not as well written and financed. The actors make a decent work in the genre, and really make the movie a better experience like say, Conan the Destroyer or Red Sonja. Not to mention that any movie where Jason Statham mutilates, beats up and utterly mangles his enemies is a huge plus. In conclusion i'd say it's a watchable entertainment package that stays loyal to the source material in good and bad, and it's not a bad sit through on a rainy day.

reviews.review_title: We had it all and lost it...
reviews.content:
I want to go study filmmaking! This movie makes me think.. and that's usually not my purpose when I watch. Certainly not a SF-movie...
Good actors, good landscapes, good effort, good story (if you can tell a story), beautiful men, nice tities, a girl I would fight for, and who doesn't want to kill orc's... PLEASE let me escape in this movie!Still... it is bad. Makes me think and wants me to go to school so that someone explains to me everything that went wrong. Maybe the makers can come to.Somethings I know, and this one because I got like seasick: don't move the camera to much! No alcohol for the cameramen (or just a little if they tremble after this new rule)
2. Don't put a horse on a roof, not even for carnaval.3. You should not fear the "cut" by the makers more than the swinging swords. A "cut" is not to feel as a knife through your storyfollowing brain.I feel sad, what a waste of good things. Maybe they should give all the footage to me or students and make a competition: fix this! Or at least make it watchable.

reviews.review_title: When you get a change to make a film on a franchise Never ask Uwe Boll again please
reviews.content: This is one great example I wished only the trailer would exist. As promising as it looks from the beginning talking about art department. Creating the world of Dungeon siege. The moment the story takes place in the forest, no real attempts of recreating the world as it should be. Uwe Boll produced four feature-length movies in 2007. Instead of creating something solid, he rushed through this project on all levels of movie making. Stay far away from this movie there is so much more to see. For Uwe Boll, I'll advise him to take some movie classes. For the time being, I learned to stay away from any of his projects. Camera and Art department and sound design are kinda good. Story writing, editing, directing, Colour grading, soundtrack are all poorly executed. to me, Uwe Boll proved one thing he managed to have a great cast and made them look bad, one of the biggest sins you can do as a director. Jason Statham proves again his fighting skills are awesome, but he doesn't need this movie to prove it.

reviews.review_title: Don't hate the movie, hate the Director...
reviews.content: This movie had so much potential...It had a great cast and because I like many of them I rate it as high as a 4. Though even the cast's acting was hurt by the director. This is some of their worst work and I entirely blame Boll.Camera angles, transitions, beginning, end... you name it Boll did it bad. The movie just throws you in the middle... and that's all it really is a middle with a climax at the end that just... well... It's and ending that doesn't seem to end much...The Director either has no creativity or is just talentless. His idea of portraying death was pitiful...The sound track was right... it fit the crappy directing!!! I want to say so much more that was bad but it would be a waste of effort and keystrokes...

Hey...like you are all good at making movies...i'd like to see your sorry arses make a better movie. Anyone who can create a film and put it on the big screen deserves a 10, good luck to all your losers.

This definitely a 4. The quality of the adaptation from the game, for what it's worth, is quite good. It's a shame that the source game chosen (Dungeon Siege) was a knockoff itself and poor at best anyway. Neither the game nor the This definitely a 4. The quality of the adaptation from the game, for what it's worth, is quite good. It's a shame that the source game chosen (Dungeon Siege) was a knockoff itself and poor at best anyway. Neither the game nor the movie really bring anything new to either genre. Uwe Boll continues to demonstrate little understanding for the audience he makes movies for and a poor ability to select decent source material.

At times it may seem like it's trying to imitate Lord of the Rings at times, but it actually ends up being it's own unique thing, while it has some cheesy moments and some bad writing, and is nowhere near as the Lord of the Rings series, it'sAt times it may seem like it's trying to imitate Lord of the Rings at times, but it actually ends up being it's own unique thing, while it has some cheesy moments and some bad writing, and is nowhere near as the Lord of the Rings series, it's still very enjoyable, has faster, more chaotic, and fun action than most other Fantasy movies, and I like how it does the video tie in, it's not based of the story of one of the games, but rather a tale set in that world (hence the name a Dungeon Siege tale), and I would like to see more video game movie do that, instead of butchering the games plot, so it is an enjoyable movie, and one I would recommend seeing.

Having heard about the movie before i sat down to watch a bad movie for entertainment. I was really surprised how good it was. Yes, its just a pulp fantasy movie, but it entertained me very well. Of course, comparing it with Lord of the RingsHaving heard about the movie before i sat down to watch a bad movie for entertainment. I was really surprised how good it was. Yes, its just a pulp fantasy movie, but it entertained me very well. Of course, comparing it with Lord of the Rings it sucks, but you know its a Uwe Boll movie so making that comparison is like comparing a pro soccer player to a guy with one leg. I've sat through way worse fantasy movies, speaking of LotR the Hobbit comes to mind, which i enjoyed way less than this (both movies in the directors cut editions). Personally I think you can compare these movies very well, both got orcs (not called orcs) and no blood, but dungeon siege got real people dressed up and not cgi. And the villain looks like David Hasselhoff.
I like Uwe Boll as a man and as a director. I don´t care what you say. But unfortunately I will have to agree that this movie isn´t good. But don´t pretend Uwe is the worst thing ever.
